revision.text:
[[File:hank asher.jpg|thumb | 200px | right | Hank Asher in front of the new TLO building in Boca Raton, Florida]] '''Hank Asher''' (May 9, 1951 - January 11, 2013)<ref name="Marketwatch.com">*[http://www.marketwatch.com/story/hank-asher-entrepreneur-technology-visionary-and-philanthropist-dies-at-61-2013-01-12 Hank Asher Obituary], "WSJ Marketwatch" loaded 31 January 2013</ref> was a [[businessman]] best known as "the father of data fusion." <ref name="reuters.com">*{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/01/12/fl-hank-asher-tlo-idUSnBw9vHVLda+11c+BSW20130112 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2017-07-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924173144/http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/01/12/fl-hank-asher-tlo-idUSnBw9vHVLda+11c+BSW20130112 |archivedate=2015-09-24 |df= }}, "Reuters" loaded 26 August 2014</ref> With a reported fortune of around US$500 million earned as the founder of several [[data fusion]] / [[data mining]] companies that compile information about companies, individuals and their interrelationships from thousands of different electronic [[database]]s.<ref name="vanityfair.com">*[http://www.vanityfair.com/ontheweb/features/2004/12/matrix200412?printable=true&currentPage=all When maverick cyber-pioneer Hank Asher invented MATRIX], ''Vanity Fair'', December 2004, loaded 14 March 2007</ref><ref name="businessweek.com">*[http://www.businessweek.com/printer/magazine/hank-ashers-startup-tlo-knows-all-about-you-09152011.html]{{dead link|date=March 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, "Bloomberg Business Week" 15 September 2011, loaded 6 October 2011</ref> “He’s kind of a legend” among those who use investigative data tools, says Greg Lambert, a legal information specialist.<ref name="businessweek.com"/>
Asher dropped out of school at the age of 16 and worked as a [[technical drawing|draftsman]] in a local [[factory]]. Later he worked in a [[Trade union|union]] job painting [[radio]] towers, with a house painting business on the side. Asher moved to [[Florida]] to avoid the seasonal shutdown in painting, soon establishing a business painting [[condominium]]s on Florida's Gold Coast. By the age of 21, he had 100 painters working for him and was reportedly grossing US$10 million a year.<ref name="vanityfair.com"/>
In 1982 Asher smuggled [[cocaine]] while living in the [[Bahamas]] over a seven-week stint, flying to [[Colombia]] and [[Belize]] in his plane. Later he joined [[F. Lee Bailey]] and the [[Drug Enforcement Administration]], convincing other Americans in Bahamas to exit the drug trade.<ref name="vanityfair.com"/> "He was never charged with a crime, but a cloud of negative publicity has hung over his head for years, even prompting his resignation from Seisint's board [in 2003]." <ref name="Sun-Sentinel.com">*[http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2004-07-16/business/0407151226_1_seisint-cancer-research-homeland-security Boca's Seisint Sold In $775 Million Deal], "Sun Sentinel" July 16, 2004, loaded December 2, 2013.</ref>
Asher touted his new company, TLO which stands for “The Last One” as having 100 times the power of his previous inventions. Development started in 2008, and in May 2011, TLOxp came out of preliminary development. Usage reached over 80,000 Law Enforcement Investigators and over 17,000 commercial accounts.<ref name="businessweek.com"/>
In 2013, the company Hank Asher founded, TLO, was in bankruptcy court with a claim of liabilities at $109 million.<ref name="bizjournals.com">*[http://www.bizjournals.com/southflorida/blog/2013/05/tlo-bankruptcy-is-company-worth-20m.html], "South Florida Business journal" May 2013</ref> In 2014, [[TransUnion]] acquired TLO for $154 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=TransUnion Closes Acquisition of TLO|url=http://www.insidearm.com/daily/collection-technologies/collection-technology/transunion-closes-acquisition-of-tlo-after-judge-approves/|website=Inside Arm|publisher=Inside Arm|accessdate=13 May 2015}}</ref>
== Enters data fusion business == Unemployed, Asher began operating as a freelance [[computer]] [[computer programmer|programmer]]. In 1992, he started a business [[DBT Online Inc|Database Technologies]] that used clusters of PCs to provide [[parallel supercomputing]] in place of more expensive mainframes and mini computers. His first contract was a data mining application for the insurance industry performed on records bought from the Florida's Department of Motor Vehicles.
DBT Online bought Asher out for US$147 million in 1999 after the FBI and the Drug Enforcement Administration suspended their contracts following revelations with Asher's involvements in drug dealing in the Bahamas and concerns that the company could potentially monitor targets of investigations.<ref name="vanityfair.com"/>
Asher blamed his ouster from Database Technologies on board member [[Kenneth Langone]] who joined the company at his invitation.<ref>[http://southflorida.bizjournals.com/southflorida/stories/2005/03/21/story1.html Database pioneer ready for new adventure], ''South Florida Business Journal'', 21 March 2005, loaded 2 April 2007</ref>
After departing DBT Online, Asher founded [[Seisint]] in 1999 by merging two companies.
ChoicePoint Public Records filed a lawsuit against Asher and Seisint in 2001 at [[Palm Beach County]] [[Circuit Court]], alleging Seisint stole technology, including source code and computer hardware. Asher counter-sued in 2001 in the [[Fort Lauderdale]] U.S. [[United States district court|District Court]] alleging unfair business practices by ChoicePoint Director [[Kenneth Langone]] and sought more than US$1.6 billion in damages. Both suits were dismissed on 8 March 2005 after ChoicePoint settled with Asher.
While at Seisint, Hank Asher played a leading role in developing the [[Multistate Anti-Terrorism Information Exchange]] (MATRIX) [[datamining]] system for the [[Florida Department of Law Enforcement]], described as a tool to help state law enforcement officials identify potential [[terrorist]]s. The MATRIX program was shut down in June 2005 after federal funding was cut in the wake of public concerns over privacy and state surveillance.<ref>[http://www.privacyinternational.org/article.shtml?cmd%5B347%5D=x-347-205261 MATRIX data mining system is unplugged] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070713221011/http://www.privacyinternational.org/article.shtml?cmd%5B347%5D=x-347-205261 |date=2007-07-13 }}, ''Privacy International'', 5 June 2005, loaded 30 March 2007</ref>
Seisint was later sold to Anglo-Dutch publishing giant Reed Elsevier in July 2004, for US$775 million and combined with its own data aggregation subsidiary, [[LexisNexis]].<ref>[https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/929869/000115697305001249/u49186e6vk.htm], {{cite web|url=http://www.gnn.gov.uk/content/detail.asp?ReleaseID%3D134074%26NewsAreaID%3D2%26NavigatedFromSearch%3DTrue |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2007-03-30 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930170829/http://www.gnn.gov.uk/content/detail.asp?ReleaseID=134074&NewsAreaID=2&NavigatedFromSearch=True |archivedate=2007-09-30 |df= }}</ref> Asher had retained a large stake in the company and said in an interview that he would earn more than $250 million from the sale.<ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A50577-2004Jul14.html LexisNexis to Buy Seisint for $775 Million], ''Washington Post'', 15 July 2004, loaded 2 April 2007</ref>
Asher made considerable donations to U.S. political parties and candidates amounting to US$735,000 from 1999 to 2004 including US$505,000 to the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrats]].<ref name="vanityfair.com"/>
==Philanthropy==
===Work with Missing and Exploited Children=== Over the course of his career in the data business, Asher donated the services of his respective companies to an indeterminable number of law enforcement agencies and most notably the [[National Center for Missing and Exploited Children]]. "No fewer than 109 children have been found as a direct result of Asher's help" according to [[Ernie Allen]], president of [[National Center for Missing and Exploited Children]]. Asher is the largest private donor in the history of the [[National Center for Missing and Exploited Children]].<ref name="vanityfair.com"/>
His final venture, TLO, focuses directly on aiding these same groups in the mission of protecting children. Asher supplied law enforcement in all 50 states and 39 countries a system that identifies pedophiles in cyberspace and is responsible for thousands of arrests and child rescues.<ref name="businessweek.com"/> He has attracted many prominent leaders to assist or support TLO:<ref>[http://www.palmbeachpost.com/localnews/content/local_news/epaper/2009/03/14/0314asher.html Boca database entrepreneur turns his attention from terrorists to pedophiles] ''Palm Beach Post'', 14 March 2009, loaded 26 May 2009</ref><ref>[http://southflorida.bizjournals.com/southflorida/stories/2009/04/06/daily44.html Asher attracts ‘Most Wanted’ support] "South Florida Business Journal", 9 April 2009, loaded 26 May 2009</ref>
*[[Bob Butterworth]], former [[Florida Attorney General]], former Director Florida Department of Children and Families *Kenneth Hunter, former Chief Postal Inspector, [[United States Postal Inspection Service]] *[http://www.spcoalition.org/lunsford.html Mark Lunsford] - Father, [[Jessica Lunsford]] *[[Mike Moore (U.S. politician)]], former [[Mississippi Attorney General]] *Ed Smart - Father, [[Elizabeth Smart (activist)|Elizabeth Smart]] *[[John Walsh (television host)|John Walsh]] - Host, [[America's Most Wanted]], Founder, [[National Center for Missing and Exploited Children]] *Revé Walsh - Founder, [[National Center for Missing and Exploited Children]]
In April 2009, Reed Elsevier filed a suit in Palm Beach County Circuit Court which alleged Asher violated his non-compete agreement with the formation of TLO. At the time, Reed Elsevier's attorney, Faith Gay stated, "He is out trying to sell a commercial product. We're seeking damages for any harm that Asher has caused to our customer base...."<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/southflorida/stories/2009/03/30/daily75.html Hank Asher sued by former company] "South Florida Business Journal", 3 April 2009, loaded 26 May 2009</ref> Asher responded with a counter-suit seeking $1 billion in damages. He said, "This lawsuit is completely without merit, and is a sad and disingenuous attempt to slow down the enormous progress we are making in our efforts to rescue children from sexual predators. I have given my systems to NCMEC for free since 1993. Every child that is rescued because of one of my systems is a paycheck for my soul. The allegation that someday I would charge for this work is insane."<ref>[http://news.prnewswire.com/ViewContent.aspx?ACCT=109&STORY=/www/story/05-01-2009/0005017594&EDATE 'Sham-ful' Behaviour: European Reed Elsevier Countersued for $1 Billion] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120322114810/http://news.prnewswire.com/ViewContent.aspx?ACCT=109&STORY=%2Fwww%2Fstory%2F05-01-2009%2F0005017594&EDATE |date=2012-03-22 }} "PRNewswire" 1 May 2009, loaded 26 May 2009</ref>
The case was dismissed 15 days prior to the expiration of the non-compete on September 1, 2009. Asher commented "I find it kind of hysterical that they sued me before I competed and the case was dismissed before the non-compete ended."<ref>[http://southflorida.bizjournals.com/southflorida/stories/2009/08/17/daily23.html LexisNexis suit against Asher dismissed] "South Florida Business Journal" 18 August 2009, loaded 20 September 2009</ref>
===Cancer Research=== Asher began his cancer research in 2001, when he put together a team of doctors and scientists. He started by philanthropically funding and working with [[Mayo Clinic]] scientists on research projects he thought had promise. Simultaneously he started clinical trials in [[Costa Rica]] to find a cure for his sister's newly diagnosed disease, [[Multiple Myeloma]].
In 2004, Asher formed JARI Research Foundation a philanthropic endeavor to support breakthrough cancer research.<ref>[http://www.jari-research.org/management/hank_asher.html Jari Research] loaded 2 April 2007 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071008070814/http://www.jari-research.org/management/hank_asher.html |date=October 8, 2007 }}</ref> The foundation evolved into JARI Research Corporation a year later, in cooperation with the Mayo Clinic. Clinical trials are conducted in the [[Dominican Republic]].
===Major Events=== Asher has a history of dedicating his personal efforts and the resources of his companies in times of crisis. Two notable events are the [[September 11 attacks]] and [[Beltway sniper attacks]].
====Attacks on September 11, 2001==== In the wake of the [[September 11 attacks]], Asher worked with the [[FBI]], constructing a secure room inside the headquarters of his company at the time, [[Seisint]]. Asher and his team of programmers worked to identify associates of the terrorists, producing lists of individuals "worth investigating" later leading to "several arrests." Asher said “You could accidentally live next door to Mohammed Atta. You couldn’t accidentally live next door to Mohammed Atta twice.”<ref>[http://www.vanityfair.com/ontheweb/features/2004/12/matrix200412 The Net's Master Data-miner] "Vanity Fair"</ref>
====Beltway sniper attacks==== At the height of the 2002 [[Beltway sniper attacks]] in the Washington, D.C., area, Asher worked with the [[FBI]] utilizing his [[data fusion]] invention, the [[Multistate Anti-Terrorism Information Exchange]] known as MATRIX to link investigation details to the real identity of [[John Allen Muhammad]]. “They produced the list of all his relatives, associates, every place he ever lived,” Asher recounts. “The next morning they were in Tacoma, Washington, cutting the stump down that had the projectiles in it that matched the projectiles from the killings.” The next evening the snipers were apprehended.<ref name="vanityfair.com"/>
== References ==

{{Infobox person | image = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1962|9|10|mf=y}} | net worth = €383.5 [[million]] (2011) }} '''Hillar Teder''' (born September 10, 1962) is an [[Estonia]]n businessman and property developer conducting his business in [[Estonia]], [[Latvia]], [[Russia]] and [[Ukraine]]. Hillar Teder is a majority [[shareholder]] in [[Arricano Real Estate plc]].
In 2011 and 2012 Hillar topped the Wealthiest People in Estonia ranking composed by the business magazine ''[[Äripäev]]'' (Business Daily), in the years 2013-2015 appeared in the top 5 positions of the list.<ref>{{cite web|author=Toomas Hõbemägi |url=http://www.balticbusinessnews.com/?PublicationId=04baf067-ba5c-4902-b0b4-7f23021e78bb |title=bbn.ee - Supermarket owner Hillar Teder tops Äripäev rich list wi |publisher=Balticbusinessnews.com |date=2011-10-23 |accessdate=2013-10-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://uudised.err.ee/index.php?06236038 |title=Äripäeva rikaste tabeli tippu tõusis Hillar Teder | ERR Uudised |publisher=Uudised.err.ee |date=2010-09-24 |accessdate=2013-10-15}}</ref>
== Early life == Hillar Teder was born on 10 September 1962 to a family of teachers. In 1980, he graduated from the Tallinn School of Science (Tallinna Reaalkool), and in 1986 from the [[Tallinn University of Technology|Tallinn Polytechnic Institute]] having majored in mechanical engineering.
His entrepreneurial career started in the early 1990s, when together with the LADA automotive centre he established Mega Avto, a company specialising in car sales in [[Russia]]. The commercial interests of the company also extended to sales of [[Audi]]<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://rus.delfi.ee/daily/business/novyj-vladelec-estonskogo-dilera-volkswagen-hochet-zahvatit-do-15-rynka.d?id=64464080 |title=Новый владелец эстонского дилера Volkswagen хочет захватить до 15% рынка |publisher=Delfi |date=2012-05-29 |accessdate=2016-01-14}}</ref> and [[Peugeot]]<ref>[http://www.postimees.ee/20826/hillar-teder-ostis-peugeot-tallinna-ja-tartu-esinduse Hillar Teder купил представительство Peugeot в Таллине и Тарту]</ref> cars in [[Estonia]] and Honda in [[Latvia]].<ref>[http://pribalt.info/abc.php?month=8&news=80 Honda в Латвии]</ref> In 1994 Hillar privatised the LADA auto centre in Tallinn.
In 1995, in conjunction with his partners Dmitriy Korzhev and Dmitriy Troitskiy in [[St Petersburg]], Hillar established Multon, a juice manufacturing company.<ref>[http://multon.ru/company/history/ «Мултон». История]</ref> The launch of trademarks Dobriy, RICH, Moya Semiya quickly converted the company into an industry leader and caught the eye of [[The Coca-Cola Company]], which bought Multon for $501 mln in 2005.<ref>{{cite web|author= Наталья РИЗОВА |url=http://www.advertology.ru/article142.htm |title=Свежевыжатый $501 млн.|publisher=Предприниматель Петербурга|date=2005-05-31 |accessdate=2016-01-14}}</ref>
The next stage in Hillar's entrepreneurial history was commercial property [[Real estate development|development]].<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.dp.ru/a/2009/11/10/Osnovatel_seti_OKej_p/ |title=Основатель сети "О'Кей" продает отель в Петербурге|publisher=dp.ru|date=2009-11-10 |accessdate=2016-01-14}}</ref> 1997 saw the commencement of construction of Rocca al Mare, Tallinn's largest shopping and entertainment centre of 35 000 sq.m.,<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://rus.db.lv/stroitel-stvo-i-nedvizhimost/nedvizhimost/estonskij-milliarder-izbavilsja-ot-nedvizhimosti-v-peterburge-27456 |title=Эстонский миллиардер избавился от недвижимости в Петербурге|publisher=db.lv|date=2010-07-05 |accessdate=2016-01-14}}</ref> financed by the international SEB Bank. Rocca al Mare was opened in 1998<ref>[http://www.roccaalmare.ee/ru/about Rocca al Mare. Из истории торгового центра]</ref> and its office building quickly became known as the Audi Tower.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://rus.delfi.ee/daily/business/samye-bogatye-akuly-nedvizhimosti-v-estonii.d?id=33361737 |title=Самые богатые "акулы" недвижимости в Эстонии|publisher=Delfi Экономика|date=2010-09-24 |accessdate=2016-01-14}}</ref><ref>[http://rus.delfi.ee/daily/business/novye-neboskreby-tallinna-foto?id=31726027 Новые «небоскребы» Таллинна]</ref>
In 2001 Hillar set up one of the first Technoparks in Estonia, which he sold in 2005.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://mke.ee/sobytija/1904-chem-nado-zanimatsja-i-s-kem-rabotat-chtoby-razbogatet-v-estonii |title=Чем надо заниматься и с кем работать, чтобы разбогатеть в Эстонии|publisher=МК Эстония|date=2011-11-18 |accessdate=2016-01-14}}</ref>
Hillar Teder is a co-founder and owner of one the largest food retailers in Russia, O'Key supermarket chain. The O'Key group was founded and registered in [[St Petersburg]] in 2001. Having opened its first hypermarket in 2002, by 2015 the total number of O'Key supermarkets in Russia reached 111 with the chain being present in 27 large cities.<ref>[http://www.okmarket.ru/about/company/ Корпоративный сайт "О'Кей Group. О нас]</ref>
Hillar is a shareholder of [[Arricano Real Estate plc|Arricano]], a leading commercial property developer who owns and operates a number of shopping centres in Ukraine (Sky Mall, RayON and Prospect in [[Kiev]], Sun Gallery in [[Kryvyi Rih]], City Mall in [[Zaporizhia]] and South Gallery in [[Simferopol]]).<ref>{{Cite web|url =http://forbes.net.ua/business/1342263-9-krupnejshih-developerov-torgovoj-nedvizhimosti/1342268#cut|title = 9 крупнейших девелоперов торговой недвижимости|author = |date =2012-11-19|publisher = forbes.ua}}</ref><ref>[http://biz.liga.net/all/nedvizhimost/novosti/2846436-v-kieve-otkrylsya-novyy-torgovyy-tsentr.htm В Киеве открылся новый торговый центр]</ref> In 2013 Arricano Real Estate became the first post-crisis Ukrainian developer to launch an IPO at the [[Alternative Investment Market|AIM]] of the [[London Stock Exchange]]. The market capitalisation at the moment of [[Initial public offering|IPO]] approximated USD 24 mln.<ref>[http://economics.unian.net/stockmarket/831604-developer-arricano-privlek-24-mln-doll-v-hode-ipo-na-londonskoy-fondovoy-birje.html Девелопер Arricano привлек 24 млн долл. в ходе IPO на Лондонской фондовой бирже]</ref><ref>[http://www.preqveca.ru/placements/359/ Arricano Real Estate PLC]</ref><ref>[http://m.lb.ua/news/2013/09/11/225764_vladelets_krupnih_ukrainskih_trts.html Власник великих українських ТРЦ залучив на біржі $24 млн] lb.ua.2013-09-11</ref>
In 2015 saw the onset of another large-scale project, a modern office and shopping complex Porto Franco in Tallinn (GBA 40 000 sq.m.).<ref>[http://portofranco.ee/en/ The story of Porto Franco]</ref><ref>[http://tallinncity.postimees.ee/galerii/63219/porto-franco/ Porto Franco]</ref>
== Incidents == Accused of bankruptcy of the Ukrainian O'Key chain by retail suppliers (in autumn of 2012 a picketing of the Estonian Embassy in Ukraine was organised by entrepreneurs).<ref>{{cite web|author= Виктор СОЛЬЦ|url=http://rus.err.ee/v/topnews/636bf0e3-7697-4e66-a04b-992a017209bb |title=Бизнесмен Хиллар Тедер|publisher=Эстонское национальное телерадиовещание|date=2013-10-10 |accessdate=2016-01-14}}</ref> The dispute was settled by reaching an amicable agreement between the creditors' committee and the O'Key Ukraine retailer.<ref>{{cite web|author=Александра НЕКРАЩУК |url=http://www.capital.ua/ru/news/40287-okey-zaplatit-po-dolgam |title="О'кей" заплатит долги|publisher=Капитал|date=2015-02-12 |accessdate=2016-01-14}}</ref>
In 2014 the scheme of Sky Mall shopping centre ownership became the point of dispute between Hillar Teder and businessman Andrey Adamovsky.<ref>{{cite web|author= Лола ТАШМАТОВА|url=http://biz.liga.net/all/nedvizhimost/intervyu/2846083-ochnaya-stavka-adamovskiyvs-teder-komu-dostanetsya-trts-sky-mall.htm |title=Очная ставка: Адамовский VS Тедер. Кому достанется ТРЦ Sky Mall|publisher=ЛIГАБiзнесIнформ |date=2014-09-25 |accessdate=2016-01-14}}</ref> In October 2015 the High Court in London upheld the [[London Court of International Arbitration]] confirming Arricano's right to a stake buyout in Sky Mall project.<ref>[http://biz.liga.net/ekonomika/fmcg/novosti/3154854-sud-razreshil-developeru-arricano-vykupit-dolyu-v-trk-sky-mall.htm Суд разрешил девелоперу Arricano выкупить долю в ТРК Sky Mall]</ref>
Hillar Teder had been mentioned alongside Vello Kunman (Silikaat Grupp owner), Villu Reiljan (former politician and mayor's counsellor) and Aivar Tuulberg (Rand&Tuulberg owner) in the context of a corruption scandal and attempted bribery of the [[List of mayors of Tallinn|Tallinn's mayor]], [[Edgar Savisaar]]. The investigation had at its disposal information on multiple bribetakings by Edgar Savisaar in the form of property and fringe benefits in the years 2014-2015. No evidence linking the businessmen to the case was ever discovered.<ref>[http://apostrophe.com.ua/news/society/accidents/2015-10-02/vo-vzyatke-meru-tallinna-zapodozrili-izvestnogo-v-ukraine-estonskogo-biznesmena/37106 Во взятке мэру Таллина заподозрили известного в Украине эстонского бизнесмена]</ref><ref>[http://rus.delfi.ee/daily/estonia/biznesmen-hillar-teder-otricaet-podozreniya-v-dache-vzyatki?id=72558343 Бизнесмен Хиллар Тедер отрицает подозрения в даче взятки]</ref><ref>[http://odnako.su/news/politics/-401984-izvestnogo-biznesmena-podozrevayut-vo-vzyatke-meru-tallina/ Известного бизнесмена подозревают во взятке мэру Таллина]</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|2}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Howard Love | birth_name = Howard Love | occupation = Entrepreneur, Investor, Author }}
'''Howard Love''' (born June 9, 1960) is an American executive, author and entrepreneur.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.marketwatch.com/story/potential-snap-ipo-effect-more-unicorns-to-wall-street-but-with-horrible-terms-2017-03-02?mod=mw_share_twitter|title=Potential Snap IPO effect: More unicorns to Wall Street, but with horrible terms|last=Poletti|first=Therese|work=MarketWatch|access-date=2018-10-30|language=en-US}}</ref> Love is the [[CEO]] of LoveToKnow, a digital publishing firm.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.producthunt.com/posts/ambition-today-23-lessons-howard-love-learned-while-sitting-on-both-sides-of-the-table|title=Ambition Today #23: Lessons Howard Love Learned While Sitting On Both Sides Of The Table - What Howard Love learned while being a founder & investor! {{!}} Product Hunt|website=Product Hunt|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-18}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.linkedin.com/company/lovetoknow|title=Howard Love|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref name="crunchbase"/>
== Career == Love founded his first company, Inmark Development, while he was an undergraduate at [[Colgate University]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/inmark-development#/entity|title=Crunchbase - InMark|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Inmark Development merged with Rogue Wave and subsequently went public.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/rogue-wave-software/press|title=Crunchbase - RogueWave|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
He is also an active [[angel investor]], usually specializing in the consumer Internet and mobile sectors.<ref name="crunchbase" /> He has made over 50 such investments including [[OpenTable]] (IPO), [[Trulia]] (IPO),  [[Titan Aerospace]] (sold to Google), [[Hotel Tonight|HotelTonight]], and others.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://angel.co/howard-love|title=Howard Love|website=angel.co|access-date=2017-06-29}}</ref> Love has been an entrepreneur for the past 30 years, and has founded or co-founded over 15 companies.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://schoolforstartupsradio.com/2016/08/start-up/|title=School for Startups Radio {{!}} August 30, 2016 – Start-Up J Curve Howard Love, College Match US David Montesano & Antidote Dr. Robert Blackman|website=schoolforstartupsradio.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-18}}</ref>
His first business book, ''The Start-Up J Curve''<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/958691971|title=The start-up J curve : the six steps to entrepreneurial success|last=Howard,|first=Love,|isbn=9781626342927|edition= First|location=Austin, Texas|oclc=958691971}}</ref> ([[Greenleaf Book Group]]) was published in 2016.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.inc.com/jeremy-goldman/the-one-lesson-that-could-save-your-startup-years-of-frustration.html|title=null|date=2016-08-30|work=Inc.com|access-date=2018-11-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/six-steps-entrepreneurial-success-000000122.html|title=Six steps to entrepreneurial success|access-date=2018-10-18|language=en-US}}</ref>
Love was born in [[Detroit]] in 1960, and attended [[Phillips Exeter Academy]] (1974-1978) and [[Colgate University]] (1978-1983). He currently resides in [[Silicon Valley]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://gigaom.com/2016/08/30/book-review-the-start-up-j-curve/|title=Book Review: The Start-up J Curve|last=Reese|first=Byron|date=2016-08-30|website=gigaom.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-18}}</ref>
He is the grandson of [[George Augustus Vaughn Jr.]] & [[George H. Love]]. His father was the CEO and chairman of National Steel and served on the boards of TWA and Monsanto.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.howardlove.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Lake-Placid-News.pdf|title=Lake Placid News|last=|first=|date=|work=Lake Placid News|access-date=}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|refs= <ref name="crunchbase">{{Cite web|url=https://www.crunchbase.com/person/howard-love#/entity|title=Crunchbase - Howard Love|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> }}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Love, Howard}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American business writers]] [[Category:American chief executives]] [[Category:American investors]] [[Category:Angel investors]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Detroit]] [[Category:Colgate University alumni]] [[Category:Businesspeople]] [[Category:Phillips Exeter Academy alumni]]

revision.comment: Ketiltrout moved page [[Intaglio (Business School Summit)]] to [[Intaglio (conference)]]
revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{advert|date=March 2013}} {{Notability|Events|date=February 2012}} }}
{{Infobox recurring event | name = Intaglio | logo = [[File:Intaglio 11.png]] | caption = ''The IIM Calcutta International Business School Meet'' | location = [[Kolkata|Kolkata (Calcutta)]], [[India]] | years_active = 20 | founded = 1989 | dates = January | genre = [[Business Festival|Business]] | attendance = 15,000 participant registrations, 190 companies | patron = [[Indian Institute of Management Calcutta]] | website = http://www.iimc-intaglio.com }}
'''Intaglio''' is the annual international Business school summit hosted by [[Indian Institute of Management Calcutta]]. The flagship event of IIM-C, it was started in 1989 as the National Business School Meet (NBSM).<ref>http://www.ireference.ca/search/Indian%20Institute%20of%20Management%20Calcutta/</ref> Intaglio, traditionally held over a 3-day weekend in January, serves as a platform facilitating the interaction of eminent personalities from the industry, academia, media and government, holding conferences, workshops and seminars by experts in different fields on a wide range of topics.
Intaglio in 2007 became the first event of its kind in India to achieve the ISO 9001:2000 certification from the International Organization for Standardization.<ref name="official-website">http://www.iimc-intaglio.com/</ref>
In 2010, Intaglio got the distinction of being the '''first carbon-neutral B-school event''' in India. This is being done through a number of environment-friendly measures such as using notepads and bags made of recycled paper and encouraging the use of social networking sites, emails and SMSes to publicise the event.<ref>http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/news-by-industry/services/education/IIM-C-walks-the-extra-green-mile/articleshow/5414503.cms</ref>
Reflecting the Golden Jubilee of IIM Calcutta, the theme of Intaglio 2011 was "''Perspectives at 50... Genesis of a new tomorrow''".
==History== The original version of Intaglio – The National Business School Meet – was started by the 25th Batch of IIM Calcutta in the year 1989. The meet consisted of a myriad of competitions viz. Strategy building competitions, presentation competition "''Shastrarth''" and the like.
The meet was rechristened "Intaglio" in the January 2002 edition.
Intaglio 2008-09 was held on the IIM Calcutta campus from 8 – 11 January 2009, this edition saw over 15,000 participants from more than 60 countries, and participation from 190 companies, The total prize money for winners across events amounted to INR 10 Lakhs.<ref>http://www.indiaprwire.com/pressrelease/education/2008092213378.htm</ref>
Every year, Intaglio organizes "Reverberations", a series of lectures by management and business leaders.
==Showcase Events==
=== Olympus === Olympus is the flagship event of Intaglio. It aims at identifying the most promising future leader amongst the students of the 6 IIMs (Ahmedabad, Bangalore, Calcutta, Indore, Kozhikode, Lucknow) and select international B-schools.
In 2009, the event was won by Ms. Joo Yi from CEIBS, China.<ref>http://www.ceibs.edu/media/archive/36032.shtml</ref> Repeating the institute's success, the following 2010 edition of the event was won by Mr. John Timms from CEIBS, China.
===Wizards of Biz=== This boardroom challenge aims at testing the all round business acumen of the participants. This game requires the participants to allocate resources, battle uncertainty and tackle competition by making the most of the limited resources available. This is the first competition in the country to have in-house real time business simulation software. Prelims give the candidates a feel of running a full-scale business in a completely dynamic environment. Those who manage to clear the preliminary rounds are further put to test in the on-campus finals involving multiple rounds of business challenges where decision making and strategic thinking are prerequisites to survive. The final round is designed to match a high pressure boardroom battle where the participants don the hats of the top level management of a firm for the coveted title.
===Chanakya=== This event gives participants the opportunity to develop a wide range of policies and test them against the wits of equally capable competition and an esteemed panel.
===Great Innovation Challenge=== The Great Innovation Challenge tests the participants on creativity and innovation, qualities that differentiate an outstanding manager from a good one. The event gives participants the opportunity to work on live problems faced by Intaglio’s knowledge partners in a real life environment. An onsite field visit, interaction with company executives and thorough mentoring by the festival’s consulting partners helps participants get to the crux of the problem at hand and devise innovative solutions.
===Consulting Knights=== Intaglio’s Showcase event, Consulting Knights, challenges the participants with a comprehensive case developed with the fest’s corporate partners that tests their ability to understand the heart of the problem and search for answers. Traditionally, one of the most prestigious events at Intaglio, Consulting knights has seen participation from all over the world including the likes of NUS, Wharton etc.
==Social Initiatives== Intaglio undertakes several social initiatives. In Intaglio 2008-09 started by holding team-building, creativity and public speaking workshops in Kendriya Vidyalaya School; this was a year-long initiative taken by the Intaglio team.
With 2009 being the year of general elections, Intaglio partnered ‘Jaago Re’ in spreading awareness about the elections to the youth of India. Furthermore, live events like inviting NGOs working with local artisans/children to exhibit their handiworks and screening daily social documentaries, were conducted.
For the online audiences, the stories and challenges Intaglio's partner NGOs faced were showcased. In the 2010-11 edition, these partnerships will be developed further to make them a permanent feature of Intaglio. Intaglio 2010-11 will feature events in collaboration with [http://iimc-intaglio.com/intaglio-cares/antyodaya/ Antyodaya] and [http://iimc-intaglio.com/intaglio-cares/sunehra-kal/ Sunehra Kal], for which Intaglio has set up a corpus of INR 400,000 to support education and women empowerment.
==Student Leadership Programme== With participation from more than 160 national & international business schools and over 175 corporates, SLP would provide students a platform to interact with some of the brightest minds from across a range of domains. SLP includes talks and panel discussions by eminent personalities like D Shivkumar, the head of Nokia India, S.K. Roongta, the Chairman of SAIL and the CEO of KKR, Joy Bhattacharya. In addition, students are also able to compete with participants from top Indian and international B-schools in On-campus events.
==Notes and references== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== *[http://www.iimc-intaglio.com Official Website] *[http://www.facebook.com/pages/Intaglio-The-IIM-Calcutta-International-B-school-Meet/105323582874007 Facebook Page]
{{Indian Institutes of Management}} {{Portal bar|Education in India}}

{{Infobox person | name = Jacob Wiese | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = Jacob Daniel Wiese | birth_date = {{bya|1981|01}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | nationality = South African | residence = [[Bantry Bay, Cape Town]], South Africa | education = | alma mater = [[Stellenbosch University]]
[[Bocconi University]]
[[University of Cape Town]] | occupation = Businessman | title = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | known for = | boards = | salary = | networth = | spouse = Jackie Hawtrey | children = | parents = [[Christo Wiese]]
Caro | relations = | website = }} '''Jacob Daniel Wiese''' (born January 1981) is a South African businessman, and the son of former billionaire [[Christo Wiese]]. ==Early life== Jacob Wiese Was born in January 1981,{{cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/officers/w9PeDXNy98pVRAiRkx-BWe5gG6o/appointments|title=Jacob Daniel WIESE - Personal Appointments (free information from Companies House)|author=|date=|website=beta.companieshouse.gov.uk|accessdate=4 September 2017}} the eldest of three children of [[Christo Wiese]] and his wife Caro.{{cite web|url=http://www.channel24.co.za/gossip/news/jacob-wiese-throws-wedding-of-the-year-20110418-2|title=Jacob Wiese throws wedding of the year|author=|date=|website=channel24.co.za|accessdate=4 September 2017}} He received a bachelor's degree in Value & Policy Studies from the [[Stellenbosch University]], a master's in International Economics & Management from the [[Bocconi University]], Italy in 2004, and bachelor's degree in Law from the [[University of Cape Town]] in 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.newlookgroup.com/investors/leadership-team|title=Leadership Team - New Look|author=|date=|website=www.newlookgroup.com|accessdate=4 September 2017}} ==Career== Wiese is an alternate and/or non-executive director of New Look, Shoprite Holdings, Pepkor Holdings, Invicta Holdings, Tradehold, Premier Foods and Fairvest Property Holdings Ltd. He is seen as the likely heir of his father's business interests.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/retailandconsumer/leisure/11718051/South-African-magnate-with-thirst-for-the-UK-high-street.html|title=South African magnate with thirst for the UK high street|author=|date=|website=telegraph.co.uk|accessdate=4 September 2017}} ==Personal life== In 2011, he married Jackie Hawtrey, a lawyer who works as a buyer for a fashion company, and the youngest child of Melville and Dawn Hawtrey of Cape Town. They live in [[Bantry Bay, Cape Town]].{{cite web|url=http://www.shannajones.com/2016/09/the-bantry-bay-cape-town-wedding-shanna-jones-photography-ty-jacob/|title=Shanna Jones · TY AND JACOB, PRIVATE HOME, BANTRY BAY, CAPE TOWN|author=|date=|website=www.shannajones.com|accessdate=4 September 2017}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wiese, Jacob}} [[Category:1981 births]] [[Category:Bocconi University alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Cape Town]] [[Category:South African businesspeople]] [[Category:Stellenbosch University alumni]] [[Category:University of Cape Town alumni]] {{SouthAfrica-business-bio-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2016}} {{Use New Zealand English|date=November 2016}} {{Infobox officeholder | image = James Gunson.jpg | honorific-prefix = | name = Sir James Gunson | honorific-suffix ={{post-nominals|country=NZL|CMG|CBE|size=100%}} | order = 24th [[Mayor of Auckland City]] | deputy = [[Andrew Entrican]] (1915-20)
Harold D. Heather (1920-22)
[[George Baildon]] (1922-25) | predecessor = [[James Parr (politician)|James Parr]] | successor = [[George Baildon]] | term_start = 1915 | term_end = 1925 | birth_date = 26 October 1877 | birth_place = [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1963|05|12|1877|10|26|df=y}} | death_place = | spouse = Jessie Helen Wiseman | children = 3 | party = Reform | }} '''Sir James Henry Gunson''' {{post-nominals|country=NZL|CMG|CBE}} (26 October 1877 – 12 May 1963) was a New Zealand businessman and [[Mayor of Auckland City]] from 1915 to 1925. He was knighted in 1924. ==W Gunson & Co== Born and educated in Auckland, in his mid-twenties he took over W Gunson & Co, the seed-grain and produce business his father founded in 1881. William Gunson died in 1902. In October 1916, now mayor of Auckland, James sold his father's stock and station agency to [[Wright Stephenson]].Business Changes Hands. ''Auckland Star'', Volume XLVII, Issue 268, 9 November 1916, Page 8 ==Public life== James Gunson stood for Parliament several times without success; ([[Roskill (New Zealand electorate)|Roskill]] in 1919, [[Eden (New Zealand electorate)|Eden]] in 1926 and then [[Auckland Suburbs (New Zealand electorate)|Auckland Suburbs]] in 1928). ==Auckland== Mayor from 1915 to 1925 he undertook the building of the war memorials [[Auckland Museum]] and Cenotaph, the [[Domain Wintergardens|Wintergardens]] in [[Auckland Domain]] and the construction of [[Tamaki Drive]]. In later public life, he was responsible for the monument on One Tree Hill ([[Maungakiekie]]) and the treeplanting of [[Cornwall Park, Auckland|Cornwall Park]] fulfilling Sir [[John Logan Campbell (politician)|John Logan Campbell]]'s vision. Gunson was Chairman of the [[Auckland Harbour Board]] 1911–15, and was a member of the Government Railways Board 1931–35. Several parts of the city bear his name or were his gift. His farming property to the South of Auckland in [[Manukau]], called Totara Park, was later given to the city of Auckland. His main town residence, in St Andrew's Road, [[Epsom, New Zealand|Epsom]], became the Tongan royal residence, which it remains. A further Auckland property (named Rydal Mount after the residence of the English poet [[William Wordsworth]]) was by the same architect, Draffin, that Gunson had chosen to design [[Auckland Museum]]. Gunson Street, in Freemans Bay, Auckland, is named after him. In 1935, he was awarded the [[King George V Silver Jubilee Medal]].{{cite news | url=http://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/cgi-bin/paperspast?a=d&cl=search&d=EP19350506.2.12 | title=Official jubilee medals | date=6 May 1935 | work= Evening Post | accessdate=14 August 2013 | page=4 }} ==Family== He married Jessie Helen Wiseman (later Lady Gunson {{post-nominals|post-noms=OBE}}) in 1905. They had three children; William, Geoffrey and Margaret. His brother Edward Burton Gunson {{post-nominals|post-noms=MD FRCP}} (1883–1950) practised as a cardiologist in Auckland 1919–37. During World War One while in the RAMC EB Gunson assisted Thomas Lewis, the noted clinical scientist, in achieving an improved understanding of the Effort Syndrome.The Soldier’s Heart and the Effort Syndrome. Thomas Lewis. London 1918. During World War Two Gunson worked for the Ministry of Supply in London publishing studies of women war workers' health.EB Gunson. British Medical Journal 1942 ii 753-5. Communal feeding. ==References== {{Reflist}} *''Who’s Who in New Zealand'', 4th edition 1941 *''Who's Who'' (UK/World edition), 1954 *[http://www.dnzb.govt.nz/DNZB/alt_essayBody.asp?essayID=3G25 Entry in ''Dictionary of New Zealand Biography''] {{S-start}} {{s-off}} {{S-bef | before = [[James Parr (politician)|James Parr]]}} {{s-ttl | title = [[Mayor of Auckland City]] | years=1915–1925}} {{s-aft | after = [[George Baildon]]}} {{End}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gunson, James}} [[Category:1877 births]] [[Category:1963 deaths]] [[Category:New Zealand stock and station agents]] [[Category:Mayors of Auckland]] [[Category:New Zealand businesspeople]] [[Category:New Zealand Reform Party politicians]] [[Category:Unsuccessful candidates in the New Zealand general election, 1919]] [[Category:Unsuccessful candidates in the New Zealand general election, 1928]] [[Category:New Zealand Companions of the Order of St Michael and St George]] [[Category:New Zealand Commanders of the Order of the British Empire]] [[Category:New Zealand Knights Bachelor]]

{{Korean name|Kang}} {{Infobox Korean name |hangul = 강덕수 |hanja = 姜德壽 |rr = Gang Deoksu |mr = Kang Tŏksu }} '''Kang Duk-soo''' (born 18 August 1950 in [[Seonsan]], [[Gyeongsangbuk-do]], [[South Korea]]) is a [[South Korea|Korean]] [[businessman]]. He currently serves as the chairman of [[STX Group]], a South Korean conglomerate company (''[[Chaebol]]''), formerly known as [[SsangYong Group|SsangYong Heavy Industries]].
In 2014, Kang was sentenced for 6 years in prison for fraud, and in 2015, a court ruled that he was not guilty of accounting fraud. <ref>http://english.donga.com/List/3/all/26/411625/1</ref>
==Education== *[[Myongji University]], Bachelor of Business Administration (1974) *[[Seoul National University]], GLP (Global Leadership Program) *[[Changwon National University]], Honorary Doctor of Business Administration (2006)
==Career== *1973 - 1995, Ssangyong Heavy Industries *1997 - 2000, Executive Vice President and [[CFO]], Ssangyong Heavy Industries *2000 - 2001, President and [[CEO]], Ssangyong Heavy Industries *2001 - 2003, President and [[CEO]], [[STX Corporation]], [[STX Pan Ocean]], [[STX Offshore & Shipbuilding]], [[STX Engine]], [[STX Energy]] *2003–Present, Chairman, [[STX Group]]
==Awards== *Silver Tower Order of Industrial Service Merit ([[Republic of Korea]], 2003) *Grand Prize of Global CEO (Japan Management Association Consulting, 2003) *Best CEO of the Year 2005 Award ([[Changwon]] City, 2005) *Grand Prize for the 1st Korea Ocean Award (Marine Industry and Technology Organization, 2007) *Honorary Citizen of Dalian City ([[Dalian]] City, [[China]], 2008) *Personality of the Year in [[Seatrade]] Asia Awards 2008 (Seatrade, 2008) *Shipbuilding Entrepreneur of the Year in [[Ernst & Young]] Entrepreneur of the Year Awards (Ernst & Young, 2009) *CEO of the Year 2009 Award (Korea Management Association, 2009) *Dasan Management Award ([[Korea Economic Daily]], 2009)
==See also== *[[Economy of South Korea]] *[[Chaebol]] *[[STX Group]] *[[STX Europe ASA]] *[[STX Offshore & Shipbuilding]]
==External links== *[http://www.stx.co.kr/ STX Corporation]
==References== {{reflist}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2010}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Kang, Duk-soo}} [[Category:1950 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from North Gyeongsang Province]] [[Category:South Korean businesspeople]] [[Category:South Korean chairmen of corporations]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Industrial Service Merit]] [[Category:South Korean criminals]]

revision.text:
{{Orphan|date=September 2018}}
{{Infobox person | name = Kanika Dewan | birth_place = [[Kolkata]] | alma_mater = [[Wharton Business School]] | awards = Guinness Book of World Records (2012) Young Global Leader (2016) | website = kanikadewan.com/ }}
'''Kanika Dewan''' is an interior designer and [[World Economic Forum]] [[Young Global Leaders|Young Global Leader]]. She is a former [[Investment banking|investment banker]] and campaigner against corruption. She has been involved with the development of Terminal 3 at [[Indira Gandhi International Airport]]. She is the president of Bahrain-based natural resources conglomerate Bramco and founder of [http://www.atelierka.com/ Ka Design Atelier].
== Early life and education == Dewan was born in [[Kolkata]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://www.wikitribune.com/story/2018/01/25/current-affairs/davos-qa-kanika-dewan-artist-in-stone-wants-to-hear-more-from-masses/44392/|title=Davos Q&A: Kanika Dewan - artist in stone wants to hear more from masses|website=WikiTribune|language=en-GB|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> Dewan moved to Bahrain when she was two years old, after her father began limestone quarrying in West Asia.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/small-biz/entrepreneurship/kanika-dewan-meet-the-diva-who-designed-floors-of-igis-terminal-3/articleshow/18308539.cms|title=Kanika Dewan: Meet the diva who designed floors of IGI's Terminal 3|last=Kumar|first=K. P. Narayana|date=2013-02-04|work=The Economic Times|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She attended an American school.<ref name=":0" /> After the outbreak of the first [[Gulf War]], Dewan was enrolled in an English boarding school.<ref name=":0" /> She majored in finance at [[Wharton Business School]], graduating in 1998.<ref name=":1"/> She joined [[Citigroup]].<ref name=":0" />
== Career == Dewan worked as an investment banker before setting up her own [[Vertical integration|vertical integrated]] design business, [http://www.atelierka.com/ Ka Design Atelier].<ref name=":1" /> In 2011 she oversaw the design and creation of the [[Guinness World Records]]' largest marble mosaic - a full-size portrait of [[Qaboos bin Said al Said]].<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.khaleejtimes.com/article/20110506/ARTICLE/305069915/1002|title=Larger than life|last=Qudoos|first=Mohammad Abdul|website=www.khaleejtimes.com|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> It included 128,274 individual marble pieces and took 3,792 hours to construct.<ref name=":2" /><ref>{{Citation|last=icecreamSoCal|title=Guinness Book of World Records: Largest Marble Mosaic in the World (Making of featurette)|date=2010-11-28|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XdXWGcFtuT4|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> The marble tiles were mined from the Omani territories Wilayat [[Mahdha]], Wilayat of Ibra, Wilayat of Ibri, [[Mirbat|Sadeh Beach]] and Quryat Beach.<ref name=":2" />
Dewan was reading a newspaper in New Delhi when she found out that proposals were underway to develop [[Indira Gandhi International Airport]].<ref name=":1" /> She decided to bid for the design, and her company won.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.indiatoday.in/magazine/supplement/story/20100816-girl-power-743701-2010-08-04|title=Girl power|website=India Today|language=en|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://whartonmagazine.com/issues/spring-2011/making-a-statement/#sthash.uNakRsjm.dpbs|title=Making a Statement|website=whartonmagazine.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She went on to design the [[Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/291013|title="I Wanted to Change India's Impression in the Minds of Americans"|last=Nathani|first=Komal|date=2017-03-24|work=Entrepreneur|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en}}</ref> Dewan has designed houses and two of the luxury yachts of the [[Sultan of Oman]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.americanbazaaronline.com/2015/04/03/narendra-modis-make-in-india-doesnt-have-incentive-for-local-companies-as-there-are-for-internationals-kanika-dewan/|title=Narendra Modi’s ‘Make in India’ doesn’t have incentive for local companies as there are for internationals: Kanika Dewan – The American Bazaar|date=2015-04-03|work=The American Bazaar|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en-US}}</ref> She designed the stone paneling system for [[The Leela Palaces, Hotels and Resorts|The Leela Palace]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.globalteacherprize.org/person?id=5874|title=Kanika Dewan|website=Varkey Foundation|language=en|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She was included in the [[Wharton magazine]] 40 Under 40.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://whartonmagazine.com/kanika-dewan/|title=Kanika Dewan|website=whartonmagazine.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> In 2012 she opened the Iron Curtain restaurant in New Delhi, which was home to an area to screen films.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/delhi/A-restaurant-for-filmmakers-and-movie-buffs/articleshow/15124202.cms|title=A restaurant for filmmakers and movie buffs - Times of India|work=The Times of India|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> In 2015 she gave the keynote lecture at Innovation Dubai.<ref>{{Citation|last=Kanika Dewan|title=Kanika Dewan Keynote Speech on Innovation Dubai|date=2015-09-06|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dN9Z92q03cU|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She was recognised as a [[Young Global Leaders|Young Global Leader]] by the [[World Economic Forum]] in 2016.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/company/corporate-trends/four-indians-figure-in-wefs-young-global-leaders-class-of-2016/articleshow/51428091.cms|title=Four Indians figure in WEF's Young Global Leaders Class of 2016|date=2016-03-16|work=The Economic Times|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.businesstoday.in/current/economy-politics/4-indians-make-it-to-world-economic-forum-global-leaders-list/story/230338.html|title=4 Indians make it to World Economic Forum global leaders list|website=www.businesstoday.in|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> In 2017 she was part of a [[United Nations]] global initiative that connected 300 Indian leaders.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.dnaindia.com/business/report-un-global-compact-to-host-event-of-300-indian-leaders-2410821|title=UN Global Compact to host event of 300 Indian leaders|date=2017-04-21|work=dna|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|last=TheUNGlobalCompact|title=27 April, 2017 - Kanika Dewan - Closing Plenary|date=2017-05-24|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r7nEsNNU4sE|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref><ref name="Speakers {{!}} UN Global Compact">{{Cite web|url=https://www.unglobalcompact.org/take-action/events/making-global-goals-local-business-india/speakers|title=Speakers {{!}} UN Global Compact|website=www.unglobalcompact.org|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She is concerned about bribery and bureaucratic red tape in India.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/294128|title=#3 Challenges Overseas Entrepreneurs Face In India|last=Nathani|first=Komal|date=2017-05-11|work=Entrepreneur|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.business-standard.com/article/economy-policy/corruption-contract-enforcement-major-hurdles-for-ease-of-business-116100600879_1.html|title='Corruption, contract enforcement major hurdles for ease of business'|last=Subramanian|first=N. Sundaresha|date=2016-10-06|work=Business Standard India|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref><ref name="Speakers {{!}} UN Global Compact"/>
=== Awards and honours === 2018 ''Global Overseas Indian Business Woman of the Year''<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=https://www.kanikadewan.com/|title=Biography, Press & Keynote Speeches {{!}} Kanika Dewan of Ka Design Ateli|website=Biography, Press & Keynote Speeches {{!}} Kanika Dewan of Ka Design Ateli|language=en|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref>
2013 ''Global Business Woman of the Year'' Entrepreneur of the Year Awards<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://cn.weforum.org/people/kanika-dewan/|title=Kanika Dewan {{!}} 世界经济论坛|website=世界经济论坛|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref>
2012 [[Society (magazine)]] Young Achiever of the Year<ref name=":4" />
2011 ''Most Innovative Woman of the Year'' Entrepreneur of the Year Awards<ref name=":4" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.naaree.com/tag/indian-women-leaders/|title=Indian Women Leaders {{!}} Naaree.com - Women At Work {{!}} Indian Woman's Magazine|work=Naaree.com - Women At Work {{!}} Indian Woman's Magazine|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.naaree.com/naaree-interviews-kanika-dewan-group-president-bramco/|title=Naaree Interviews Indian Woman Entrepreneur, Kanika Dewan, Bramco {{!}} Naaree.com - Women At Work {{!}} Indian Woman's Magazine|date=2011-10-19|work=Naaree.com - Women At Work {{!}} Indian Woman's Magazine|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en-US}}</ref>
2010 ''Woman Initiative of the Year''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://naseba.blob.core.windows.net/upload/WIL_ME_Post_Event_Report_2010_2nd_edition.pdf|title=2nd Annual Women in Leadership Forum|last=Tolani|first=Teena|date=2010-11-24|website=NASEBA|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-08-25}}</ref>
2005 Prism Award, Marble Institute of America<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.stoneworld.com/articles/83035-2005-prism-stone-in-architecture-awards|title=2005 Prism Stone In Architecture Awards|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en}}</ref>
2001 Best Design & Workmanship, Marble Institute of America<ref name=":3" />
== References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dewan, Kanika}} [[Category:People from Kolkata]] [[Category:Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania alumni]] [[Category:Interior designers]] [[Category:Businesspeople]] [[Category:Indian businesspeople]] [[Category:21st-century Indian businesspeople]]

revision.comment: Robot - Removing category Irish people of Huguenot descent per [[WP:CFD|CFD]] at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2018 September 27]].
revision.text:
[[File:Louis Crommelin.jpg|thumb|Louis Crommelin in 1700]] '''Samuel-Louis Louis Crommelin''' (1652–1727) was a French [[Huguenot]] exile, who became director of an Irish [[linen]] business.
==Life== Crommelin was born in May 1652 at [[Armandcourt]], near [[Saint-Quentin, Aisne|Saint-Quentin]] in [[Picardy]], into a family of landowners with a tradition of growing [[flax]]; his father, Louis Crommelin, married in 1648 to Marie Mettayer, was wealthy and had four sons, Samuel-Louis, Samuel, William, and Alexander. Samuel-Louis Crommelin, called Louis, was in business flax-spinning and linen-weaving. The family was [[Protestant]], and the [[Revocation of the Edict of Nantes]] in 1685 hit hard even though Louis was a Catholic convert of 1683. With his son and two daughters he made his way to [[Amsterdam]]. There he became partner in a bank, and was joined by his brothers Samuel and William.<ref name="DNB">{{cite DNB|wstitle=Crommelin, Samuel-Louis|volume=13}}</ref>
Under [[William III of England|William III]] and [[Mary II of England|Mary II]], [[Thomas Southwell, 1st Baron Southwell|Thomas Southwell]] had access to funds to develop Irish industry.<ref name="Southwell">{{cite ODNB|id=26068|first=Kilbutn|last=Matthew|title=Southwell, Thomas}}</ref> Huguenot linen-workers had been encouraged to settle at [[Lisburn]] where already there was some manufacture of linen. In 1696 the English parliament passed an act admitting all products of [[hemp]] and flax duty free from Ireland to England; the Irish parliament in November 1697 passed an act for fostering the linen manufacture. William III's policy was to discourage the Irish woollen trade, but to build up linen manufacture there.<ref name="DNB"/> Crommelin was the most prominent Huguenot attracted by Southwell.<ref name="Southwell"/> He arrived at Lisburn in the autumn of 1698, and made recommendations for improving the linen industry in a memorial of 16 April 1699; which were implemented quickly. Crommelin was made "overseer of the royal linen manufacture of Ireland", and lent money for the scheme. In 1702 [[Anne, Queen of Great Britain|Queen Anne]] confirmed its royal patent.<ref name="DNB"/>
Crommelin began by ordering looms from Flanders and Holland, and Huguenot weavers were introduced. He adopted Irish [[spinning-wheel]] but worked to improve it. His maker of the reeds, which control the [[warp thread]]s, was Henry Mark du Pré (d. 1750), of [[Cambrai]].<ref name="DNB"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.craigavonhistoricalsociety.org.uk/rev/luttonlinentrade.html|title=''The Linen Trade in Co. Armagh'', craigavonhistoricalsociety.org.uk|accessdate=26 February 2017}}</ref>
[[Francis Seymour-Conway, 1st Baron Conway|Baron Conway]] gave a site for weaving workshops, and Irish apprentices were taken on. Dutchmen were engaged to teach flax-growing to farmers, and to superintend bleaching operations. It is not without some reason that Crommelin has been credited with originating, as regards Ulster, a system of technical education for the textile art. Crommelin was assisted by his brothers, and the linens and [[cambric]]s could replace imported textiles. In 1705 a factory was opened at [[Kilkenny]], under the management of William Crommelin.<ref name="DNB"/>
Crommelin expanded operations, with the manufacture of hempen [[sailcloth]] at [[Rathkeale]] and other locations. He was given a pension in 1716, and died at Lisburn on 14 July 1727, aged 75. He was buried, with other Huguenots, in the eastern corner of the graveyard of [[Lisburn Cathedral]].<ref name="DNB"/>
==Family== [[File:CrommelinGraveLisburnCathedral.JPG|thumb|Crommelin grave, Lisburn Cathedral]] The wife of Louis Crommelin was named Ann. She survived her husband by twenty-eight years, dying August 17, 1755, at the age of 97. Their only son, Louis, born at St Quentin, died at Lisburn on 1 July 1711, aged 28. Their daughter, Mary Madelien, who married Captain de Bernière, died 8 July 1715, aged 21. All four are buried in the family vault in the churchyard of Christ Church Cathedral, Lisburn.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Crommelin|first1=Jacob|title=Early History of the Crommelin Family, Part 3|url=http://www.crommelin.org/history/Ancestors/Scheffer/Part3/History03.htm|website=Crommelin.org|accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref>
The Crommelin family became extinct in the main line, but the name survived in a branch of the family of de la Cherois, connections by marriage.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Gordon|first1=Alexander, ed.|title=Dictionary of National Biography, 1885-1900|url=https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Crommelin,_Samuel-Louis_(DNB00)|website=Wikisource|accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref>
==Notes== {{reflist}}
;Attribution {{DNB|wstitle=Crommelin, Samuel-Louis|volume=13}}
{{authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Crommelin, Louis}} [[Category:French businesspeople]] [[Category:Linen industry in Ireland]] [[Category:1652 births]] [[Category:1727 deaths]] [[Category:People from Picardy]]

revision.comment: /* Index Ventures */
revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Michelangelo "Mike" Volpi | image = File:Mike Volpi.png | imagesize = | caption = Venture Capitalist Mike Volpi | occupation = Partner of [[Index Ventures]] | residence = [[California]], [[United States of America|USA]] | alma_mater = [[Stanford University]] }}
'''Michelangelo "Mike" Volpi''' (born 13 December 1966) is an Italian-American businessman and [[venture capitalist]]. He co-founded [[Index Ventures]]’ [[San Francisco]] office with [[Danny Rimer]] in 2009 and was previously [[Chief Strategy Officer]] of [[Cisco Systems]] during the company’s prominent growth era, acquiring over 70 companies in less than five years.<ref name="businessweek">{{Cite news |title= Michaelangelo Volpi Vice-president, business development Cisco Systems |work= Business Week |author= Andy Reinhardt |date= August 25, 1997 |url= http://www.businessweek.com/1997/34/b354172.htm |accessdate= June 2, 2013 }}</ref><ref name="Forbes.com">{{cite web |title= Forbes.com profile |url= https://www.forbes.com/profile/mike-volpi/}}</ref> In 2007 he left Cisco and became [[Entrepreneur in Residence]] (EIR) at [[Sequoia Capital]]. A few months later, he was appointed CEO of [[Joost]], and in 2009 he became General Partner at [[Index Ventures]].<ref name="Mercury">{{cite news |title= Elevator Pitch: Mike Volpi on his past at Cisco and the future of Android |url=http://www.mercurynews.com/2014/03/10/elevator-pitch-mike-volpi-on-his-past-at-cisco-and-the-future-of-android/ |work= The Mercury News |date= March 10, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title= Volpi Leaves Joost for Index Ventures |url=http://www.adweek.com/digital/volpi-leaves-joost-for-index-ventures/ |work= AdWeek |date= July 6, 2009}}</ref>
==Early life== Volpi was born in [[Milan]], Italy. When he was five, his family moved to [[Tokyo]], Japan, where he lived until he moved to the United States in 1984 to attend [[college]]. He earned a BS in Mechanical Engineering (1984-1988) and an MS in Manufacturing Systems Engineering (1988-1989) from [[Stanford University]].<ref name="linkedin">{{Cite web |title= Mike Volpi |work= LinkedIn profile |url= http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=15020024 |accessdate= June 2, 2013 }}</ref>
Volpi began his career at [[Hewlett Packard]]'s optoelectronics division in 1989 where he was both in engineering and marketing.<ref name="businessweek"/> While at HP, he met his future wife Toni C. Cupal.<ref name="nndb">[http://www.nndb.com/people/610/000138196/ Mike Volpi<!-- Bot generated title -->], [[nndb.com]]</ref> He returned to Stanford to earn an [[M.B.A.]] from the Graduate School of Business (1992-1994).<ref name="linkedin" />
== Cisco == Volpi joined Cisco Systems in 1994 in the nascent business development group. He was promoted to leading acquisitions at Cisco starting in April 1996. As Chief Strategy Officer for the company he led corporate strategy, business development, and strategic alliances. During his tenure, he and his team were responsible for the acquisition of over 70 companies in seven years, including a nearly $7 Billion acquisition of [[Scientific Atlanta]].<ref>[http://www.crunchbase.com/person/mike-volpi Mike Volpi | CrunchBase Profile<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Their acquisition strategy of Volpi and his team at Cisco is widely regarded as a model for technology [[mergers and acquisitions]].<ref>[http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/01_09/b3721084.htm Can Mike Volpi Make Cisco Sizzle Again? - Businessweek<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> he was promoted to the chief strategy office working for CEO [[John Chambers (CEO)|John Chambers]] until 2000. Some press speculated he was [[heir apparent]] to Chambers.<ref>[https://allthingsd.com/20070913/kara-visits-with-joosts-mike-volpi-part-1/ Kara Visits With Joost's Mike Volpi, Part 1 - Kara Swisher - News - AllThingsD<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name="cnet">[http://news.cnet.com/Mike-Volpis-trek-from-Cisco-to-Joost/2008-1023_3-6189080.html Mike Volpi's trek from Cisco to Joost - CNET News<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Moving into an operational role as a senior vice president and general manager, he led the routing and switching teams, then co-led the routing and service provider group with Prem Jain until 2007.<ref>[http://news.cnet.com/Cisco-veteran-Volpi-to-step-down/2100-1014_3-6157393.html?tag=lia;rcol Cisco veteran Volpi to step down - CNET News<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> During this time Cisco's first [[Carrier Routing System]] product was announced, the CRS-1, in 2004.<ref>{{Cite news |title= CRS-1: The Foundation for the Future of Communications |date= May 25, 2004 |work= News release |url= http://newsroom.cisco.com/dlls/2004/hd_052504.html |archivedate= June 3, 2004 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20040603053747/http://newsroom.cisco.com/dlls/2004/hd_052504.html |accessdate= June 2, 2013 }}</ref>
From 2007 until 2009, Volpi was CEO of [[Joost]],<ref name="cnet"/><ref>[http://kara.allthingsd.com/20090706/mike-volpi-jumps-from-joost-to-index-a-boomtown-interview-and-full-press-release/ Interview: Mike Volpi, Former Joost CEO, Now at Index Ventures - Kara Swisher - News - AllThingsD<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name=autogenerated1>[http://gigaom.com/2009/07/06/former-joost-ceo-mike-volpi-jumps-to-index-ventures/ Former Joost CEO Mike Volpi Jumps to Index Ventures — Tech News and Analysis<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.businessinsider.com/mike-volpi-out-as-joost-chairman-2009-9 Mike Volpi Out As Joost Chairman - Business Insider<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> an Internet startup focused on online TV which was founded by [[Skype]] founders Niklas Zennstrom and Janus Friis.<ref>[http://eetimes.eu/en/joost-taps-cisco-vp-mike-volpi-as-ceo?cmp_id=7&news_id=199901152 Joost taps Cisco VP Mike Volpi as CEO - Electronics Eetimes<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> In September 2009, a lawsuit was filed against Volpi by Skype’s founders in conjunction with the proposed divestiture of Skype from eBay.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB125328729155823251#mod=WSJ_hps_LEFTWhatsNews | work=The Wall Street Journal | first=Geoffrey A. | last=Fowler | title=Skype Founders File Another Suit in eBay Saga | date=21 September 2009}}</ref> The lawsuit was dropped in November 2009.<ref>[http://kara.allthingsd.com/20091104/i-love-the-smell-of-settlement-in-the-morning-skype-founders-set-to-get-10-percent-option-to-buy-three-percent-more-and-two-board-seats/ Skype Lawsuit Settlement Details - Kara Swisher - News - AllThingsD<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
== Index Ventures == At Index Ventures, Volpi invests in early-stage companies, primarily across [[autonomous driving]], enterprise and [[open source model|open source]].<ref>{{cite news |title= A "Perfect Storm" Moment for Multibillion-Dollar Open Source Companies|url=https://www.recode.net/2014/3/25/11624942/a-perfect-storm-moment-for-multibillion-dollar-open-source-companies |work= recode |date= March 24, 2014}}</ref> Volpi has served on the boards of Index portfolio companies [[Big Switch Networks]], [[Blue Bottle Coffee Company|Blue Bottle Coffee]] (acquired by Nestle),<ref>{{cite news |title= Nestlé acquires a majority stake in Blue Bottle Coffee at a valuation north of $700M|url=https://techcrunch.com/2017/09/14/nestle-acquires-a-majority-stake-in-blue-bottle-coffee/ |work= TechCrunch |date= September 14, 2017}}</ref> Confluent Software, Elastic ({{NYSE|ESTC}}), [[Hortonworks]], Lookout, [[Pure Storage]] ({{NYSE|PSTG}}), [[Sonos]] ({{NASDAQ|SONO}}), Ubiquity6, and [[Zuora]] ({{nyse|ZUO}}).<ref>{{cite news |title= Index Ventures' Mike Volpi on Enterprise Investments|url=https://www.recode.net/2014/6/12/11627922/index-ventures-mike-volpi-on-enterprise-investments |work= recode |date= June 12, 2014}}</ref><ref name="TechCrunch1">{{cite news |title= Ask A VC: Index Ventures’ Mike Volpi On What To Look For In A Board Member And More|url=https://techcrunch.com/2013/05/03/ask-a-vc-index-ventures-mike-volpi-on-what-to-look-for-in-a-board-member-and-more/ |work= TechCrunch |date= September 14, 2017}}</ref>
During Volpi's time at Index, the firm has grown its office in [[San Francisco]] and now has an equal presence on both sides of the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic]].<ref name="TC3">{{cite news |title= Index Ventures Has A New, $550 Million Fund, And A New Partner |url=https://techcrunch.com/2016/02/03/index-ventures-has-a-new-550-million-fund-and-a-new-partner-too/ |work= TechCrunch |date= February 3, 2016}}</ref> In the last few years, the firm has had six [[initial public offerings]] in the US, including [[Dropbox (service)|Dropbox]] ({{nyse|DBX}}), [[Etsy]] ({{nasdaq|ETSL}}), [[Sonos]] and [[Zuora]], and has invested in early rounds of companies including self-driving car startup Aurora,<ref>{{cite news |title= Aurora On The Rise: Robocar Startup Snags $90 Million, Adds Reid Hoffman, Mike Volpi To Board|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/alanohnsman/2018/02/28/aurora-on-the-rise-robocar-startup-snags-90-million-adds-reid-hoffman-mike-volpi-to-board/#be92b342f331 |work= Forbes |date= February 28, 2018}}</ref> [[Bird (company)|Bird]] and [[Robinhood (company)|Robinhood]].<ref>{{cite news |title= Index Ventures Has Been on a Run. Now It’s Raising Funds to Keep It Up.|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/09/business/dealbook/index-ventures-funds.html |work= New York Times |date= July 9, 2018}}</ref>
== Other Board Memberships and Non-Profit Involvement == Volpi is a non-executive board member of [[Fiat Chrysler Automobiles]] ({{NYSE|FCAU}}), an independent director of European investment firm [[Exor (company)|Exor]] ({{ISE|NL0012059018|EXO}}),<ref>{{cite news |title= Agnelli heir makes bet on family fortune |url= https://www.ft.com/content/ba2b8b4a-12cb-11e7-80f4-13e067d5072c |work= FT |date= April 4, 2017}}</ref> and was a board member of Swedish mobile giant [[Ericsson]] from 2010 to 2013.<ref>[http://www.ericsson.com/thecompany/press/releases/2010/03/1391510 Two new members nominated to Board of Directors - Ericsson<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.ericsson.com/thecompany/press/releases/2013/03/1683132 Ericsson's Annual General Meeting 2013 - Ericsson<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He previously served on the board(s) of [[Opsware]] (now [[Hewlett-Packard|HP]]),<ref>[http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20030820005196/en/Opsware-Adds-Independent-Board-Members-Noted-Industry Opsware Inc. Adds Two New Independent Board Members; Noted Industry Leaders Mike Volpi and Mike Homer Elected to Board of Directors | Business Wire<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[TIBCO|TIBCO Software]], [[Skype]], [[StorSimple]], [[Apache CloudStack|Cloud.com]], and [[Clearwire]].
Volpi currently serves sits on the board of Castilleja School, an independent school for girls grades 6-12 in [[Palo Alto]], California,<ref>{{cite web |title= Castilleja School: Board of Trustees |url= http://www.castilleja.org/page.cfm?p=940954}}</ref> and is a Global Advisory Board Member at [[Knight-Hennessy Scholars]], an international graduate-level scholarship program for study at [[Stanford University]].<ref>{{cite web |title= Stanford University Knight-Hennessy Scholars |url= https://knight-hennessy.stanford.edu/people/michael-volpi}}</ref> He previously served on the board of [[Witness (organization)|Witness]], a non-profit organization that uses video to open the eyes of the world to [[human rights]] violations,<ref>[http://www.witness.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1046&Itemid=168 Human Rights Videos | witness.org<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and on the Advisory Council for the [[Stanford University Graduate School of Business]].
== Personal life == Volpi is trilingual, and married with 2 children. His father is Vittorio Volpi, an executive at the [[United Bank of Switzerland]].<ref name="nndb"/>
== Awards == *''[[Forbes]]'' [[Midas List]]: World's Smartest Tech Investors, 2015<ref>{{cite news|title=The Midas List 2015|url=https://www.forbes.com/midas/#tab:overall_page:10|accessdate=7 April 2015|work=Forbes.com|issue=Midas List|date=25 March 2015}}</ref> * ''[[MIT Technology Review]]'' - [[TR35|Innovators Under 35]], 1999<ref>{{cite web |title= MIT Technology Review: Innovators Under 35|url= http://www2.technologyreview.com/tr35/profile.aspx?TRID=540}}</ref> * ''[[Network World]]'': 1999 Power Issue – 25 Most Powerful People in Networking<ref>[http://www.networkworld.com/power99/power99-25volpi.html Mike Volpi, 12/27/99<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121014214254/http://www.networkworld.com/power99/power99-25volpi.html |date=2012-10-14 }}, ''[[Network World]]''</ref> * ''[[The New York Times]]''' and CB Insights' 2018 list of the top 100 venture capitalists worldwide featured Volpi at number 34.<ref name="CB2018">{{cite web |title= The Top 100 Venture Capitalists |url= https://www.cbinsights.com/research/top-venture-capital-partners/}}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist|2}}
