{{Infobox person | honorific_prefix = | name = Mishal Hamed Kanoo | honorific_suffix = | image = Mishal Kanoo.jpg | image_size = | alt = Mishal Hamed Kanoo | caption = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | birth_name = | birth_date = February 25, 1969 | birth_place = [[United Arab Emirates]] | baptised = | disappeared_date = | disappeared_place = | disappeared_status = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | body_discovered = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | monuments = | residence = | nationality = | other_names = | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | occupation = [[Chairman]] of [[The Kanoo Group]] | years_active = | alma_mater = [[University of St. Thomas (Texas)|University of St. Thomas]]
Houston, Texas
Bachelor of Arts in Economics & Business Administration; MBA (Finance)
[[American University of Sharjah]]
Sharjah, UAE
EMBA (General) | era = | employer = | organization = | agent = | known_for = | notable_works = | style = | home_town = | salary = | net_worth = | height = | weight = | television = | title = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | movement = | opponents = | boards = | denomination = | criminal_charge = | criminal_penalty = | criminal_status = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | callsign = | awards = | website = {{URL|http://www.mishalkanoo.com}} | footnotes = }} '''Mishal Hamed Kanoo''' ([[Arabic]]:مشعل حمد كانو, born 25 February 1969), is a [[UAE]] [[business magnate]]{{cite news|url=http://www.emirates247.com/eb247/news/the-art-of-big-business-2008-12-05-1.228990|title=The art of big business|last=Rahimi|first=Safura|publisher=''Emirates 24/7''|date=5 December 2008|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/economy/kanoo-group-deputy-chairman-takes-aim-at-the-uae-corporate-landscape|title=Kanoo Group deputy chairman takes aim at the UAE corporate landscape|last=Kane|first=Frank|publisher=''[[The National (Abu Dhabi)|The National]]''|date=9 December 2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/dubai-expo-2020-reaction-from-leaders-528657.html|title=Dubai Expo 2020: Reaction from leaders -- Mishal Kanoo, Deputy Chairman of Kanoo Group|publisher=''[[Arabian Business]]''|date=28 November 2013|accessdate=19 October 2015}} and currently serves as the [[Chairman]] of [[The Kanoo Group]] based in UAE and [[Oman]]. Kanoo was listed as one of the ''Top 100 Powerful Arabs 2017'',http://gulfbusiness.com/lists/100-powerful-arabs-2017/ ''Power 100'',{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/power-100-mishal-kanoo-88201.html|title=Arab Power 100 - Mishal Kanoo|publisher=[[Arabian Business]]|date=26 March 2008|accessdate=19 October 2015}} ''Rich List 2009'',{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/rich-list-2009/list?view=profile&itemid=150310#.Vd2pvfmqpHw|title=Rich List 2009: 9th: The Kanoo Family ($6.1b)|publisher=''[[Arabian Business]]''|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.campdenfb.com/article/top-60-family-business-leaders-2014|title=Top 60 Family Business Leaders 2014|publisher=''Campden FB''|date=25 February 2014|accessdate=19 October 2015}} and ''The World's Richest Arabs''.{{cite news|url=http://www.msn.com/en-ae/money/today/the-world%E2%80%99s-richest-arabs-2014/ss-BBgrJMm#image=10|title=The World's Richest Arabs 2014: The Kanoo Family|publisher=MSN Money / Arabian Business|date=12 July 2014|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.metransparent.com/old/texts/the_world_50_richest_arabs.pdf |format=PDF |title=The World's 50 Richest Arabs |publisher=Metransparent.com |accessdate=2015-11-05}} Kanoo is the 4th generation to run the Kanoo family business. Established in [[Bahrain]] in 1890, The Kanoo Group's parent company, [[Yusuf Bin Ahmed Kanoo]] grew from its early trading and shipping enterprise into a diversified conglomerate across the [[Middle East]], founded by Haji Yusuf Bin Ahmed Kanoo.{{cite web|url=http://kanoo.com/about_us/index.aspx|title=Kanoo Corporate Website|publisher=Kanoo.com|accessdate=2015-11-03}} From Bahrain, the business spread to [[Saudi Arabia]] in the 1930s.{{cite news|url=http://www.saudiembassy.net/files/PDF/Publications/Magazine/1998-Winter/commercial.htm|title=Saudi Arabia's thriving commercial sector|publisher=SaudiEmbassy.net website|date=Winter 1998|accessdate=19 October 2015}} In 1967, Kanoo's father, Hamed Kanoo came to the UAE to expand the family business. He successfully put up The Kanoo Group as a trade name in the country, which currently operates in UAE and Oman.{{cite web|url=http://www.kanoogroup.com/history.html|title=Many opportunities. One address, 125 years of experience|publisher=The Kanoo Group|accessdate=2015-11-03}} In 2015, Kanoo took over his role as the Chairman of The Kanoo Group after the death of Chairman Yusuf Ahmed Kanoo in 2014. Today, The Kanoo Group operates across a range of industries{{cite web|url=http://www.kanoogroup.com/ourbusiness.html|title=Many opportunities. One address, 125 years of experience|publisher=The Kanoo Group|accessdate=2015-11-03}} in shipping, travel, machinery, logistics, property, energy (oil, gas, electric, water), [[Chemical industry|industrial chemicals]], training, retail, and commercial activities,{{cite news|url=http://www.constructionweekonline.com/article-9026-engineering-plant-opens-in-dubai-industrial-city/|title=Engineering plant opens in Dubai Industrial City|last=Whitaker|first=Greg|publisher=''Construction Weekly'' Online|date=23 July 2010|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.constructionweekonline.com/article-12240-the-kanoo-group-snaps-up-stor-mat/|title=The Kanoo Group snaps up Stor-mat|last=White|first=Stephen|publisher=''Construction Weekly'' Online|date=8 May 2011|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabiansupplychain.com/article-7378-etihad-to-open-joint-retail-locations-with-kanoo-travel/|title=Etihad to open joint retail locations with Kanoo Travel|publisher=''Arabian Supply Chain / Arabian Industry.com''|date=12 April 2012|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=https://www.zawya.com/story/The_Kanoo_Group_and_IPS_UK_form_joint_venture-ZAWYA20141023072317/|title=The Kanoo Group and IPS UK form joint venture|publisher=Zawya.com|date=23 October 2014|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://news.thomasnet.com/companystory/mishal-kanoo-signs-dp-world-supply-deal-20007269|title=Mishal Kanoo Signs DP World Supply Deal|publisher=ThomasNet.com - Industry News|date=23 April 2013|accessdate=19 October 2015}} as well as other joint ventures.{{cite web|url=http://www.kanoogroup.com/jointventure.html|title=Many opportunities. One address, 125 years of experience|publisher=The Kanoo Group|accessdate=2015-11-03}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabiansupplychain.com/article-1189-sdv-forms-partnership-with-dnata-cargokanoo/|title=SDV forms partnership with Dnata Cargo/Kanoo|publisher=Arabian Supply Chain / Arabian Industry.com|date=8 July 2008|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianindustry.com/supply-chain/comments/2011/aug/3/why-is-kanoos-latest-acquisition-so-important-3735095/#.Vf_k5d-qpHw|title=Why is Kanoo's latest acquisition so important?|last=Cuthbert|first=Jon|publisher=Arabian Industry.com|date=3 August 2011|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=https://www.thebusinessyear.com/uae-dubai-2015/partner-of-choice/interview|title=Partner of Choice - TBY talks to Mishal Hamed Kanoo, Deputy Chairman of the Kanoo Group, on the company's philosophy, potential investment opportunities, and the outlook for the future|publisher=TheBusinessYear.com|date=2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.aircargonews.com/080728/FT080728.html|title=Dnata Has Room to Grow|publisher=''Air Cargo News''|date=28 July 2008|accessdate=19 October 2015}} Furthermore, Kanoo is a member of the Superbrands Council of the United Arab Emirates. ==Early life and education== Born in [[Dubai]] and educated until high school locally, Kanoo continued his college studies in the United States. He took Comparative Theology and Philosophy and double major in [[economics]] as his first degree and later earned his [[MBA]] in [[Finance]] from the [[University of St. Thomas (Texas)|University of St. Thomas]] in Houston.{{cite news|url=http://www.stthom.edu/Public/getFile.asp?IsDownload=0&File_Content_ID=111983|title=The Sage of Dubai . Two degrees from UST Provide Foundation for Success for One of the World's Most Influential Businessmen|publisher=University of St. Thomas Houston magazine - Report to the Community ''Making an Impact 2014''|date=2014|accessdate=19 October 2015}} He joined the family firm fresh out of university in 1991 as an Assistant Shipping Manager. Kanoo left the business for a time to pursue higher learning and later earned his second MBA at the [[American University of Sharjah]]{{cite web|url=http://www.aus.edu/info/200136/graduate_programs/309/executive_master_of_business_administration_emba/3|title=Students and Alumni - Executive Master of Business Administration (EMBA) - American University of Sharjah|work=aus.edu}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aus.edu/news/article/209/american_university_of_sharjah_mba_program_ranked_best_in_gulf_by_forbes_middle_east|title=American University of Sharjah MBA program ranked best in Gulf by Forbes Middle East|work=aus.edu}} where he subsequently became a visiting lecturer on a course in Family Business. He worked at [[Arthur Andersen]] in Dubai as an auditor before returning to The Kanoo Group as the Deputy Chairman in 1997.{{cite news|url=http://quotes.wsj.com/AE/XADS/GCIC/company-people/executive-profile/129147868|title=Green Crescent Insurance Co. -- Key People -- Mishal Hamed Kanoo - Independent Non-Executive Director, Green Crescent Insurance Co. PJSC|publisher=''[[The Wall Street Journal]]''|accessdate=19 October 2015}} At that time, his uncle, Mubarak Kanoo, was the chairman of the holding company.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/industry-insights/economics/kanoo-groups-rebel-in-residence|title=Kanoo Group's rebel in residence|last=Duncan|first=Gillan|publisher=''[[The National (Abu Dhabi)|The National]]''|date=24 June 2011|accessdate=19 October 2015}} He served as the Deputy Chairman until the time he took up his most recent role. ==Career== [[File:Tkg-family.jpg|right|thumb|Kanoo Family Tree]] Kanoo is a frequent [[Public speaker|speaker]]{{cite web|url=http://speakers.sk/speakers/mishal-kanoo|title=Mishal Kanoo|work=speakers.sk}}{{cite web|url=http://rightselectionspeakerbureau.com/leadership/mishal-kanoo/|title=Right Selection Speakers Bureau - Mishal Kanoo - Right Selection Speakers Bureau|work=rightselectionspeakerbureau.com}} at conferences in the Middle East, and around the world at events where an independent Middle East view is required.{{cite news|url=http://gulfnews.com/news/gulf/qatar/doha-debates-panellists-counter-western-slander-against-dubai-1.566107|title=Doha Debates panellists counter Western slander against Dubai|last=Toumi|first=Habib|publisher=''[[The Gulf News]]''|date=19 October 2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.londonspeakerbureau.com/speakers/mishal__kanoo|title=Mishal Kanoo|work=londonspeakerbureau.com}}{{cite news|url=https://globalconnections.hsbc.com/uae/en/articles/risk-key-growth-opportunity|title=Mishal Kanoo explores risk as a key growth opportunity|publisher=HSBC Global Connections|date=5 August 2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dubaichronicle.com/2010/09/19/fundforum-middle-east-invites-mishal-kanoo-the-kanoo-group-as-guest-speaker-at-bahrain-conference/|title=FundForum Middle East invites Mishal Kanoo, The Kanoo Group, as guest speaker at Bahrain Conference|publisher=''Dubai Chronicle''|date=19 September 2010|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00pzgzd|title=HARDTalk: Stephen King, Mishal Kanoo and Robert J Shapiro|publisher=BBC News Channel|date=12 January 2010|accessdate=19 October 2015}} Some of his speaking engagements include the World Summit on Innovation and Entrepreneurship in Dubai,{{cite news|url=http://www.albawaba.com/news/world-summit-innovation-entrepreneurship-be-held-muscat-april-1-3-2006|title=World Summit on Innovation & Entrepreneurship to be held in Muscat from April 1-3, 2006|publisher=AlBawaba|date=2 March 2006|accessdate=19 October 2015}} and [[The International Herald Tribune]]s CEO Roundtable in Malaysia.{{cite news|url=http://www.prurgent.com/2010-09-30/pressrelease122271.htm|title=Mishal Kanoo expresses concerns at Alternative Investments in Asia Forum (press release)|publisher=PR Urgent|date=30 September 2010|accessdate=19 October 2015}} As visiting lecturer at the American University of Sharjah School of Business Administration,{{cite web|url=http://www.aus.edu/info/200171/school_of_business_administration/|title=School of Business Administration|work=aus.edu}}{{cite web|url=http://ausbusinessforum.com/Entrepreneurship.php|title=AUS Business Forum|work=ausbusinessforum.com}} he is an advocate of education and believes that it allows people to take responsibility and control of their lives.{{cite news|url=http://gulfnews.com/culture/people/company-is-family-1.25417|title=People: Company is family|last=Chaudhary|first=Suchitra Bajpai|publisher=''[[The Gulf News]]''|date=10 January 2008|accessdate=19 October 2015}} He was a columnist for ''[[MONEYworks]]'' Magazine,{{cite web|url=http://www.4-traders.com/business-leaders/Mishal-Kanoo-081YMP-E/biography/|title=Mishal Hamed Kanoo, MBA|work=4-traders.com}} ''[[Arabian Business]]'', ''Gulf Business''{{cite web|url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/The+seven+deadly+sins+of+family+firms.-a0220710905|title=The seven deadly sins of family firms.|work=thefreelibrary.com}} and ''[[7days]]'',{{cite web|url=http://7days.ae/news-8649/8687|title=Mishal Kanoo|work=7DAYS UAE}} and continues to voice his views by regularly writing articles for local and regional media about social and business affairs in the Gulf and global capital markets, adeptly spelling out the ethical and religious values, blending them with modernity and progress.{{cite web|url=http://luxurylifestyleawards.com/en/news/210.html|title=Family values that compelling from generation to generation.|work=luxurylifestyleawards.com}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/tackling-gulf-s-generation-game-588499.html#.ViNUu34rLcs|title=Tackling the Gulf's Generation Game|last=Townsend|first= Sarah|publisher=''[[Arabian Business]]''|date=10 April 2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/new-visa-laws-won-t-boost-property-says-kanoo-414186.html|title=New visa laws won't boost property, says Kanoo|last=Ferris-Lay|first=Claire|publisher=''[[Arabian Business]]''|date=4 August 2011|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/kanoo-backs-permanent-visas-for-long-term-expats-40054.html|title=Kanoo backs permanent visas for long-term expats|last=Bladd|first=Joanne|publisher=''[[Arabian Business]]''|date=15 February 2010|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/quotas-no-answer-spike-in-emirati-joblessness-373294.html|title=Quotas no answer to spike in Emirati joblessness|last=Leigh|first=Karen|publisher=''[[Arabian Business]]''|date=12 January 2011|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.khaleejtimes.com/article/20150210/ARTICLE/302109879/1037|title=Mena firms told to project brands better globally|last=D'mello|first=Sandhya|publisher=''[[Khaleej Times]]''|date=10 February 2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}} {{cite news|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/mishal-kanoo--family-affair-587749.html|title=Mishal Kanoo: A family affair|last=Trenwith|first=Courtney|publisher=''[[Arabian Business]]''|date=3 April 2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/-you-can-see-greed-in-people-s-eyes-mishal-kanoo-talks-dubai-588311.html|title='You can see greed in people's eyes' – Mishal Kanoo talks Dubai|last=Trenwith|first=Courtney|publisher=''[[Arabian Business]]''|date=8 April 2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/economy/kanoo-group-deputy-chairman-takes-aim-at-the-uae-corporate-landscape|title=Kanoo Group deputy chairman takes aim at the UAE corporate landscape|last=Kane|first=Frank|publisher=''[[The National (Abu Dhabi)|The National]]''|date=9 December 2014|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/economy/dubai-businessman-says-bribery-in-middle-east-commercial-life-swept-under-the-carpet|title=Dubai businessman says bribery in Middle East commercial life ‘swept under the carpet'|last=Kane|first=Frank|publisher=''[[The National (Abu Dhabi)|The National]]''|date=23 October 2014|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.hoteliermiddleeast.com/8149-travel-boss-labels-budget-airlines-a-myth/|title=Travel boss labels budget airlines a 'myth'|last=Canty|first=Monika|publisher=Hotelier Middle East.com|date=29 April 2010|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-233458671.html|title=Leader adds to calls.|work=highbeam.com}}{{cite web|url=http://7days.ae/news-6070/6103|title=Tackling the crisis|work=7DAYS UAE}} ===Other businesses=== Apart from the family business, Mishal is also a Professional and Motivational Speaker and holds chief positions as Chairman / [[Director (business)|Director]] of other companies including: * Dubai Express LLC/ Freightworks {{cite news|url=http://www.arabiansupplychain.com/article-6244-freightworks-welcomes-new-managing-director/|title=Freightworks welcomes new managing director|aurthor=|publisher=Arabian Supply Chain.com|date=21 July 2011|accessdate=19 October 2015}} * Johnson Arabia LLC {{cite web|url=http://www.kanoogroup.com/jhonsonarabia.html|title=Many opportunities. One address, 125 years of experience|publisher=The Kanoo Group|accessdate=2015-11-03}} * Wolffkran Arabia LLC {{cite news|url=http://www.gulfconstructionworldwide.com/news/8418_Wolffkran-enters-the-UAE-crane-market.html|title=Wolffkran enters the UAE crane market|publisher=Gulf Construction Worldwide.com|date=1 March 2007|accessdate=19 October 2015}} * BRC Arabia LLC {{cite web|url=http://www.kanoogroup.com/brcarabia.html|title=Many opportunities. One address, 125 years of experience|publisher=The Kanoo Group|date=2012-06-06|accessdate=2015-11-03}} * AkzoNobel UAE Paints LLC {{cite news|url=http://www.constructionweekonline.com/article-19797-akzonobel-signs-jv-to-expand-in-middle-east/|title=AkzoNobel signs JV to expand in Middle East|publisher=''Construction Weekly'' Online|date=1 December 2012|accessdate=19 October 2015}} * Gulf Capital Pvt. JSC {{cite web|url=http://www.gulfcapital.com/en-US/1/56/Board-of-Director-Detail/62/Mr--Mishal-Kanoo|title=Gulf Capital - Leading Alternative Investment Company in the Gulf -- Mr. Mishal Kanoo|work=gulfcapital.com}} * AXA Insurance (Gulf) (C) BSC {{cite news|url=http://gulfnews.com/business/sectors/banking/axa-to-take-major-stake-in-uae-s-green-crescent-insurance-1.1294871|title= AXA Gulf expands UAE, regional operations|publisher=''[[The Gulf News]]''|date= 19 October 2012|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://gulfnews.com/business/sectors/banking/axa-to-take-major-stake-in-uae-s-green-crescent-insurance-1.1294871|title=AXA Gulf expands UAE, regional operations|publisher=''[[Gulf Today]]''|date=19 October 2012|accessdate=19 October 2015}} * Green Crescent Insurance Company PJSC {{cite web|url=http://www.green-crescent.com/article/board-of-directors.html|title=Green Crescent|work=green-crescent.com}} * Dalma Capital Management Limited {{cite news|url=https://en-maktoob.news.yahoo.com/dubai-hedge-fund-firm-adds-top-uae-tycoon-074051879--finance.html|title=Dubai hedge fund firm adds top UAE tycoon to board|publisher=en-Maktoub / ''[[Arabian Business]]''|date=7 March 2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.arabianindustry.com/oil-gas/news/2015/mar/5/dalma-capital-appoint-mishal-kanoo-to-the-board-4974840/#.Vf_jp9-qpHw|title=Dalma Capital appoint Mishal Kanoo to the Board|last=Kelly|first=Christopher|date=5 March 2015|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://gulfnews.com/business/sectors/banking/axa-to-take-major-stake-in-uae-s-green-crescent-insurance-1.1294871|title=AXA to take major stake in UAE's Green Crescent Insurance GCIC provides health and life insurance services in the UAE|publisher=Reuters / ''[[Gulf News]]'' - Banking|date=23 February 2013|accessdate=19 October 2015}} * KAAF Investments http://www.arabianbusiness.com/industries/banking-finance/381358-kanoo-group-to-launch-two-new-investment-entities * KHK & Partners Ltd http://khkandpartners.com/board-of-directors-MishalKanoo.html ==Philanthropy== Kanoo has been integrating corporate [[philanthropy]]{{cite news|url=http://www.campdenfb.com/article/%E2%80%9Cwealth-provides-no-social-benefit-void%E2%80%9D|title=Mishal Kanoo - "Wealth That Provides No Social Benefit Is Void"|last=Stern|first=Melanie|publisher=Campden FB|date=1 March 2004|accessdate=19 October 2015}} in one of his missions to foster community-based sustainable developments in areas such as arts,{{cite news|url=https://dubaifilmfest.com/en/news/17/150987/dubai_international_film_festival_and_dubai_cares_present_the_global.html|title=Dubai International Film Festival and Dubai Cares present the Global Gift Gala|publisher=Dubai Film Fest|date=3 December 2014|accessdate=19 October 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.kanoogroup.com/thiranottam.html|title=Many opportunities. One address, 125 years of experience|publisher=The Kanoo Group|accessdate=2015-11-03}} education,{{cite web|url=http://news.hct.ac.ae/2009/05/graduates-honoured-for-academic-excellence/|title=Graduates honoured for academic excellence|work=HCT News}} health, [[social welfare]],{{cite web|url=http://kanoomarketing.blogspot.ae/2014/05/the-kanoo-group-attends-sightsavers.html?q=Sightsavers|title=The Kanoo Group Blog: The Kanoo Group attends Sightsavers event as charity supporter|work=blogspot.ae}}{{cite web|url=http://bizbahrain.com/content/kanoo-group-johnson-arabia-and-axa-gulf-lead-charity-event|title=The Kanoo Group, Johnson Arabia and AXA Gulf Lead Charity Event|work=bizbahrain.com}}{{cite web|url=http://m.dubaiprnetwork.com/pr.asp?pr=85863|title=The Kanoo Group graces cancer charity event as Platinum Sponsor|publisher=M.dubaiprnetwork.com|accessdate=2015-11-03}}{{cite web|url=http://www.kanoogroup.com/uaecancercharity-platinumsponsor.html|title=Many opportunities. One address, 125 years of experience|publisher=The Kanoo Group|accessdate=2015-11-03}} [[project management]],{{cite web|url=http://www.dipmf.ae/sponsors/|title=Dubai International Project Management Forum - Sponsors|work=dipmf.ae}} sports, http://www.liverpoolfc.com/playersawards2016/home and the [[natural environment]].{{cite web|url=http://www.kanoogroup.com/sustainability.html|title=Many opportunities. One address, 125 years of experience|publisher=The Kanoo Group|accessdate=2015-11-03}} ==Interests== ===Meem Gallery=== [[File:Interests.jpg|thumb|right|alt=Kanoo|My collection is not bought as an investment but for their sheer artistic power and aesthetic pleasure. For an art, one sees something created out of nothing. - ''Mishal Kanoo'']][[File:Antiqorum001.jpg|right|thumb|Kanoo [left] with Peter Elsner-Mackay, [[Ambassador]] of [[Austria]] to the UAE during the Antiquorum exhibition]] Kanoo is an influential figure in the progress of Dubai's art scene.{{cite web|url=http://gulfnews.com/gn-focus/a-long-haul-1.939038|title=A long haul|last=Abraham|first=Megha|work=gulfnews.com}}{{cite web|url=http://hauteliving.com/2015/03/mishal-kanoo-breaking-the-status-quo/557134/|title=Mishal Kanoo: Thinking Outside of the Status Quo|work=Haute Living}}{{cite web|url=http://insideoutmagazine.ae/an-ode-to-middle-eastern-art-1.764832|title=An ode to Middle Eastern art|last=Moosa|first=Lena|work=insideoutmagazine.ae}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bi-me.com/main.php?id=9494&t=1|title=Emirates Investment Services brings fresh perspective to asset management - Business Intelligence Middle East - bi-me.com - News, analysis, reports|work=bi-me.com}} As an eccentric collector, a pride of place in his office goes to a painting of Cuban revolutionary Che Guevara by the Bahraini artist Jamal Abdul Raheem.{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/featured-content/channel-page/business/middle-article-list/adding-to-a-collection-can-be-an-art-in-itself|title=Adding to a collection can be an art in itself|last=Duncan|first=Gillian|work=thenational.ae}} He supported the creation of one of Middle East's fastest-growing art districts in Dubai, the Meem Gallery in 2007. He launched the Meem Gallery together with [[Sultan Sooud Al-Qassemi]], a member of Sharjah's royal family and founder of [[Barjeel Art Foundation]]{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/arts-lifestyle/art/sharjahs-barjeel-art-foundation-makes-a-dramatic-debut-in-kuwait|title=Sharjah's Barjeel Art Foundation makes a dramatic debut in Kuwait|last=Seaman|first=Anna|work=thenational.ae}} and British curator, Charles Pocock.{{cite web|url=http://www.english.globalarabnetwork.com/201006276368/Culture/uae-barjeel-art-foundation-interview-with-sultan-sooud-al-qassemi.html|title=Global Arab Network - UAE: Barjeel Art Foundation - Interview with Sultan Sooud Al-Qassemi - Culture - Culture|last=Taha|first=Hannan|work=globalarabnetwork.com}}{{cite web|url=http://gulfartguide.com/dubai/meem-gallery/|title=Meem Gallery|work=gulfartguide.com}} Meem Gallery's expertise lies in modern and contemporary Arab and Iranian art.{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/arts-lifestyle/art/abu-dhabi-art-offers-artists-an-international-crossroads|title=Abu Dhabi Art provides for an international crossroads for artists from the world over - The National|last=Seaman|first=Anna|work=thenational.ae}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/arts-culture/art/junes-best-uae-art-exhibitions|title=June's best UAE art exhibitions|last=Seaman|first=Anna|work=thenational.ae}} In addition to exhibiting important modern and contemporary works, the Meem Gallery encourages a greater understanding of Middle Eastern art through its publications available at Noor Library. The Noor Library of Middle Eastern Art, held at Meem Gallery, is one of the largest international resource centres for the arts of the Middle East.{{cite web|url=http://www.visitdubai.com/en/pois/the-meem-gallery-and-noor-library|title=The Meem Gallery and Noor Library|work=visitdubai.com}} ===Collections=== As an art connoisseur,{{cite web|url=http://www.gulfconnoisseur.com/connoisseur2011/Connoisseur_2011/Welcome.html|title=Dubai, UAE, November 21, 2011|work=gulfconnoisseur.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.emirates247.com/eb247/companies-markets/collectors-take-the-spotlight-2008-02-22-1.214265|title=Collectors take the spotlight|last=Fernandez|first=Keith J.|work=Emirates 24-7}} Kanoo's hobbies include a collection of fine paintings, as well as [[Islamic art]] such as Spanish masters and calligraphy.{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aQi_UBK5LK4g|title=Oil Millionaires Chase Dwindling Supply of Islamic Treasures|work=bloomberg.com}}{{cite web|url=http://m.gulfnews.com/life-style/general/an-ode-to-middle-eastern-art-1.764832|title=An ode to Middle Eastern art|work=gulfnews.com}} He is also fascinated with exclusive pens and watches.{{cite web|url=https://www.definewatches.com.au/node/985|title=Kanoo Minute Repeater|work=definewatches.com.au}}{{cite web|url=http://www.horologyme.com/tag/mishal_kanoo/|title=Mishal Kanoo - Horology Middle East|work=horologyme.com}}{{cite web|url=http://kanoomarketing.blogspot.ae/2014/11/antiquorum-together-with-mishal-kanoo.html|title=The Kanoo Group Blog: Antiquorum together with Mishal Kanoo hosts rare watches display in Dubai|work=blogspot.ae}}{{cite web|url=http://www.alphamagazine.ae/features/rare-watches-on-display-in-dubai-1.1405053|title=Rare watches on display in Dubai|work=alphamagazine.ae}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mpp-me.com/MEWatch/index.html|title=MPP-ME LLC- Latest Business News on the Jewellery & Watch World in the Middle East|work=mpp-me.com}} In November 2014, Kanoo placed to spotlight more than 200 ‘Important Modern & Vintage Timepieces' in Dubai{{cite web|url=http://www.gulftoday.ae/portal/3670ddff-df30-48aa-9daa-3829bfc60951.aspx|title=Watch this space|publisher=gulftoday.ae|date=2014-11-06|accessdate=2015-11-03}} to preview the highlights of the auction to be held in [[Geneva]] by hosting one of the world's premier watch exhibitions, Antiquorum (the first auction house to auction fine watches over the Internet in the 1990s). Kanoo finds time to cultivate his [[Bibliophilia|love of books]] most especially about arts, literature and philosophy genres. He is also a motoring enthusiast.{{cite web|url=http://www.emirates247.com/eb247/news/the-art-of-big-business-2008-12-05-1.228990|title=The art of big business|last=Rahimi|first=Safura|work=Emirates 24-7}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/economy/what-executives-from-the-uae-and-beyond-are-reading-this-summer|title=What executives from the UAE and beyond are reading this summer|work=thenational.ae}} {{clear}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{Official website|http://www.mishalkanoo.com/}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kanoo, Mishal Hamed}} [[Category:Emirati businesspeople]] [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:Living people]]

revision.comment: Copying from [[Category:Philippines men's national basketball team players]] to [[Category:Filipino men's basketball players]] using [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]
revision.text:
{{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalSport | Men’s [[Basketball]]}} {{MedalCountry | {{PHI}} }} {{MedalCompetition|[[Basketball at the Asian Games|Asian Games]]}} {{MedalGold|[[1951 Asian Games|1951 New Delhi]]| [[Basketball at the 1951 Asian Games|Team competition]]}} {{MedalBottom}} <!---Note: Full name given either as Luis F. Lorenzo or Luis Francisco R. Lorenzo---> '''Luis Francisco "Chitong" Lorenzo''' (died April 12, 1997),<ref name=MoroNeg>{{cite news |author= |title= 'The Moro Negatives' by Isa Lorenzo |publisher= ''Philippine Daily Inquirer'' |quote= |date= 2008-09-26 |url= http://www.ateneo.edu/index.php?p=120&type=2&sec=39&aid=3463 |accessdate= 2011-11-02 }}</ref><ref name=InMemL>{{cite news |author= Ateneo de Manila University |title= In Memoriam: L |publisher= |quote=Luis Francisco R. Lorenzo Sr., Moro, HS'47 AB'51, ''12 April 1997'' |date= 2007-03-27 |url= http://www.ateneo.edu/index.php?p=120&type=2&sec=39&aid=3463 |accessdate= 2011-11-02 }}</ref><ref name=AIMLorenzo>{{cite news |author= Asian Institute of Management |title= Sources and Uses of Power - Luis "Cito" P. Lorenzo, Jr. |publisher= |quote="Luis “Chitong” Lorenzo, Sr. a former basketball star turned corporate executive of the Del Monte Philippines Inc. (DMPI). |date= |url= http://www.supr.aim.edu.ph/lorenzo/ |accessdate= 2011-11-14 }}</ref> better known as '''"Moro" Lorenzo''' and also as '''Luis F. Lorenzo, Sr.''', was a former [[Filipino people|Filipino]] basketball player and corporate executive.
Lorenzo played college basketball for the [[Ateneo Blue Eagles|Ateneo de Manila]]. The fabled Blue Eagle was the original one-hand set-shooter of Philippine basketball. The dusky cager from Zamboanga was the scoring ace of the Eagles who thrilled the NCAA crowd in the years 1947 to 1951. He moved on to play for Philippine Airlines in the [[Manila Industrial and Commercial Athletic Association]].
After his playing years, Lorenzo became manager of Del Monte Packing Corporation plantation in Bukidnon from 1964 to 1970. He was elected to the Constitutional Convention and by the 1970s, he was vice president of his company with offices at Makati, Rizal.
Later on, he was also part of the [[Philippines men's national basketball team|Philippine national basketball team]] that won the gold medal at the [[Basketball at the 1951 Asian Games|1951 Asian Games]]. He was also the owner of the [[Talk 'N Text Tropang Texters|Pepsi Bottlers]] basketball team in the [[Philippine Basketball Association]], and the chairman and president of [[Pepsi-Cola Products Philippines, Inc.]] The [[Moro Lorenzo Sports Center]] inside the [[Ateneo de Manila University]] is named after him.
Lorenzo married Dr. Alicia “Alice” Paez. His son, Luis P. Lorenzo Jr., is an influential Filipino businessman and politician, having served as Secretary of Agriculture and a presidential advisor.<ref>[http://www.da.gov.ph/wps/portal/!ut/p/kcxml/04_Sj9SPykssy0xPLMnMz0vM0Y_QjzKLN4gP8gLJgFjGpvqRqCKOcAFfj_zcVP0gfW_9AP2C3NCIckdHRQAh95Nt/delta/base64xml/L0lDU0lKQ1RPN29na21BISEvb0VvUUFBSVFnakZJQUFRaENFSVFqR0VBLzRKRmlDbzBlaDFpY29uUVZHaGQtc0lRIS83XzBfMUFWLzExMA!!?WCM_PORTLET=PC_7_0_1AV_WCM&WCM_GLOBAL_CONTEXT=/wps/wcm/connect/DA+Site/About+us/History+of+Philippine+Agriculture/ History of Philippine Agriculture on Department of Agriculture website]</ref><ref name=LPLorenzoJr>{{cite news |author= Luis P. Lorenzo, Jr. |title= Cultivating Entrepreneurial Spirit in Asia |publisher= |quote= |date= |url= http://www.hitachi.com/society/global/hyli/5th/speech/pdf/lorenzo.pdf |accessdate= 2011-11-02 }}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.mlscsports.com Moro Lorenzo Sports Center]

revision.text:
{{advert|date=May 2014}}
{{Infobox company |name = Nodosa S.L. |logo = Nodosa Shipyard.jpg |type = [[Limited Society]] |foundation = 1982 |founder= Don Manuel Dopico Lamas[[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]] Don Jaime Novas García [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]] |key_people = |image =Vista general de las instalaciones en Marín..jpg |industry = [[Shipbuilding]], [[Shiprepair]]. |location = [[Bueu]], ([[Pontevedra]]). [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]] [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]], [[Spain]] [[Spain]] |products = [[Shipbuilding]], [[Shiprepair]] |num_employees = From 50 to 100 |num_locations = l |homepage = http://www.nodosa.com/ |discontinued = }}
'''Nodosa Shipyard''' is a [[Shipyard]] dedicated to the construction, modification and repair of all kinds of metal hull [[Watercraft|vessel]]s of up to 150 meters [[length]], as well as general industrial manufacturing.
Located in the northwest of [[Spain]], particularly in the region of [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]], the [[Shipyard]] currently has three operational centers working in the province of [[Pontevedra]], the factory in the parish of [[Bueu]], the yard and the repair center in the [[Marín (Pontevedra)|Marin]] Port Authority sited in the [[Marín (Pontevedra)|homonymous parish]] and the workshop located in the city of [[Pontevedra]], provincial capital.
== History ==
[[File:BA 2 OMVAC DIEZ 02.jpg|thumb|left|Split hopper dredger "Omvac Diez"]]
Nodosa Shipyard was born over 40 years ago as an auxiliary company for metal industry. In 1982 inaugurates its metalworking shops and in the early 90s acquires the concession of a small dock. After successive stages of growth and expansion, the first one becomes the current factory and the head office, and the second one in the today's shipyard. Other workshops have been added in parallel, as the mechanical workshop ([[Nodosafer]]).
On January 19, 2015, the company formalized the acquisition of Factoria Naval de Marin shipyard (FNM),<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.farodevigo.es/portada-o-morrazo/2015/02/03/nodosa-propietaria-legal-factoria-naval/1177207.html |title=Nodosa is already legal owner of Factory Naval after signing purchase deed |publisher= www.farodevigo.es | accessdate= 3 February 2015 | language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.atlantico.net/articulo/economia/nodosa-queda-factoria-naval-marin-y-plantilla/20141126100610448156.html |title=nodosa acquires FNM and its workers |publisher= www.atlantico.net |accessdate=26 November 2014 |language=spanish}}</ref> which includes both facilities and the granting of land use, and also the property over the historical shipbuilder and its brand ''Marin Luxury Yachts'' names.
== Marine division == [[File:Yate01.JPG|thumb|Yacht "Y-102"]] Dedicated exclusively to shipbuilding and shiprepair of steel hull vessels.
The shipyard builds mainly [[tug]]s and maritime assistance vessels, dredgers and port workboats as [[Pontoon (boat)|pontoon]]s, [[barge]]s, [[lighter]]s... It also build cargo ships (multipurpose), tankers, offshore vessels and [[fish boat]]s as [[tuna]] fishing vessels, [[Longline fishing|longliners]], [[Fishing trawler|trawler]]s, [[purse seiner]]s or auxiliary vessels for [[aquaculture]] and trap.
It was precisely the construction of all kind of fishing vessels which gave rise to the company, thanks to a geographical linkage to a seafaring region as the [[Rías Baixas]], [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]], where fishing represents one of the most important economic activities.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.shaio.es/jornadas/1jeaio/PAP_IOJ1_usc_doldan_etal.pdf | title= Importance of fisheries in Galicia | publisher = www.usc.es |accessdate= 23 September 2005 | language = Spanish }}</ref> Furthermore, [[Galicia (Spain)|Galician]] community, is one of the world's major power in the field of [[aquaculture]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.magrama.gob.es/ministerio/pags/Biblioteca/Revistas/pdf_reas%2Fr160_10.pdf |title= Importance of aquaculture in Spain |publisher = www.magrama.gob.es |accessdate= 12 August 2008 |language = Spanish }}</ref>
[[File:BC 2 PESQUERO ARRASTRERO 02.jpg|thumb|left|Trawler "Cantábrico Tres".]] Other outstanding shipbuildings were [[submarine]]s of different capabilities that allow passenger to view the seabed, passenger vessel for commercial and tourist routes, [[sailboat]]s of different dimensions, [[yacht]]s, [[yacht|megayachts]], general cargo ships, multipurpose, [[merchant vessel]]s, [[Tanker (ship)|tanker]]s, any kind of carrying vessel, platforms support and rescue vessels and other offshore vessels, [[ferry|ferries]] or any other kind of [[boat]]s.
Turnkey manufacturing is another important area in the company. Nodosa covers works commissioned by other shipyards, be they logistics services, cutting or material forming; producing blocks; carrying out any of the stages in shipbuilding: hull, superstructure, fitting out, piping...
The shipyard also performs repair, modernization and conversion of ships, conducted both in its facilities and afloat. As significant figures, the average values by type of repair in the period 2001-2013 are shown below:
* Sleepway repairs average: 86.62 * Afloat repairs average: 48.38 * Total repairs average: 135
==Industrial Division==
[[File:BB 3 SUPPLY 03.jpg|thumb|Supplier "ESVAGT Bergen"]]
Industrial Division has gradually diversified into different sectors, such as manufacturing and ship repair, maintenance and industrial fitting, manufacture of metal structures for construction … it also produced different elements related to such traditional sectors as the granite, timber and catching sectors … or to such leading edge fields as wind power and aeronautics.
The company has an independent mechanical workshop, which has specialized machinery for work and machine different parts used in the shipyard or in other outside companies.
Finally, the company has carried out works of design, manufacture and assembly in different industrial sectors.
[[File:AA 3 REMOLCADORES IIII.jpg|thumb|left|Tugs working.]]
It has a 18,000 m2 logistic capability, which allows storage of up to 3,000 tons of material. In addition, the shipyard can carry, cut and shape materials such as steel and aluminum alloys in different quality grades, thicknesses and sizes, for later assembly at the client projects or delivering the final product.
Finally, the company makes engineering developments for chemical, mining, gas&oil, shipbuilding, aeronautical, wind and railway sectors. Also for granite industry, wood or for different areas such art, where the shipyard has actively collaborated with the [[Madrid|madrilenian]] sculptor [[Carlos Albert]].
== Ships built at Nodosa Shipyard (selection) ==
Below are the most relevant constructions carried out by Nodosa.

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2017}} {{EngvarB|date=May 2017}} {{Location map | United Kingdom Nottingham Greater | lat = 52.953| long = -1.149 | caption = Nottingham city centre }} [[File:RiverTrentNottingham.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Looking towards the city centre from Victoria Embankment.]] [[File:Robinhood Sculpture Nottingham.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Robinhood Sculpture Outside Nottingham Castle]] [[File:Nottingham Close up.JPG|thumb|250px|right|Nottingham skyline from Porchester .]] [[File:Ye Olde Trip To Jerusalem.jpg|thumb|250px|right|[[Ye Olde Trip To Jerusalem]], reputedly the oldest pub in England.]][[File:The Newton Building, Nottingham (4) - geograph.org.uk - 656572.jpg|thumb|250px|[[Nottingham Trent University]]'s Newton Building]]
'''Nottingham city centre''' is the cultural, commercial, financial and historical heart of [[Nottingham]], England. Nottingham's city centre represents the central area of the [[Greater Nottingham]] [[conurbation]].
The centre of the city is usually defined as the [[Old Market Square]] – the UK's largest city square. A major redevelopment of the Old Market Square was completed in March 2007. Many of the main shopping streets abut the square, which is dominated by Nottingham's [[Nottingham Council House|city hall]]. The building's landmark dome may be seen for miles around. Much of the ground floor of the building houses the [[Exchange Arcade#Exchange Arcade|Exchange Arcade]], a [[boutique]] shopping centre.
A [[Bohemian style|Bohemian]] quarter of the city known as [[Hockley Village|Hockley]] has arisen in recent years, situated close to the [[Lace Market]] area.
The north-western end of the city centre is home to the [[Nottingham Trent University]] city campus which contains a lively mix of old and new buildings. The [[Nottingham Trent University|University's]] Newton building is one of the tallest buildings in Nottingham and has a prominent position on the city's skyline.
Nottingham's [[Nottingham railway station|central railway station]] is located in the city centre. [[Nottingham Express Transit]] trams also service the area.
==Shopping== Nottingham city centre has been voted 5th in [[Experian]]'s list of the top 15 UK retail areas.<ref>[http://strategies.experian.co.uk/News/~/media/Files/News/Retail%20risk%20rankings%20%20%20tables.ashx Shopping Rankings]</ref>
The city centre's fashion core is centred on [[Bridlesmith Gate]], which is home to upmarket names such as [[Kurt Geiger]], [[Ted Baker]] and [[Diesel S.p.A.|Diesel]]. [[Paul Smith (fashion designer)|Sir Paul Smith's]] flagship store is located on Middle Pavement, and [[Hugo Boss]] is located on St. Peter's Gate. London-based [[Harvey Nichols]] now have plans to open a store in the Broadmarsh area but it depends on the development that is due to take place over the year.
==Zones== {{Main article|Nottingham Parksmart}}
Nottingham city centre is split into five "zones" which were introduced with the [[Nottingham Parksmart]] scheme in 2009 to signpost visitors to parking facilities and tourist attractions. The zones are:
*[[Nottingham Parksmart#Zones|Lace Market]] *[[Nottingham Parksmart#Zones|Broadmarsh]] *[[Nottingham Parksmart#Zones|Castle]] *[[Nottingham Parksmart#Zones|Royal]] *[[Nottingham Parksmart#Zones|Victoria]]
==Visitor attractions== [[Nottingham Castle]] is a popular attraction for visitors to the city due to its links with [[Robin Hood]]. The Brewhouse Yard Museum (Museum of Nottingham Life) and the Museum of Costume and Textiles are close by.
Part of Nottingham's expansive cave network is open to the public through the [[City of Caves]] attraction, and the [[Galleries of Justice]] on [[High Pavement]] were once a fully functioning Victorian [[courtroom]].
Notable churches within the city centre include the [[Roman Catholic]] [[Nottingham Cathedral]], and the medieval [[St. Mary's Church, Nottingham|St. Mary's Church]] at the heart of the Lace Market.
The [[National Ice Centre]] (adjoined to Capital FM Arena Nottingham) is located close to the city's Lace Market quarter and is the first twin Olympic ice-pad facility in the UK. It is the home of the [[Nottingham Panthers]], a professional [[ice-hockey]] team.
[[Rock City (club)|Rock City]] is a mid-sized music venue that draws many popular bands from across the world, and so is an important part of Nottingham's [[music tourism]] scene.
==Entertainment== Nottingham is home to a wide variety of entertainment venues, the largest of which is the 10,000-seater [[Capital FM Arena]] (part of the National Ice Centre), where many big-name acts perform regularly.<ref>[http://www.nottingham-arena.com Trent FM Arena]</ref>
The city's major producing theatre, the [[Nottingham Playhouse]], has built up a national reputation for its exciting, innovative and contemporary new works.
The Nottingham Royal Centre incorporates the 2,500-seater [[Nottingham Royal Concert Hall|Royal Concert Hall]] and the [[Victorian architecture|Victorian]] [[Theatre Royal, Nottingham|Theatre Royal]]. The Royal Concert Hall is the region's top venue for classical music and regularly plays host to world-class orchestras and ballets, while the Theatre Royal is considered one of the finest venues in the country for major touring [[West End theatre|West End]] musicals and plays.
The city is also the forerunner of Improvisational Comedy in the midlands, MissImp (Mission Improbable) is a growing force in the comedy scene in Nottingham. A student group also runs at the University of Nottingham. And the famous [[Glee Club]] situated along the Nottingham Canal<ref>http://www.glee.co.uk/nottingham</ref>
[[The Corner House, Nottingham|The Corner House]] entertainment complex houses a multi-screen [[Cineworld|Cineworld cinema]] and a multitude of continental pavement-cafes and restaurants, a casino, a simulation pilot spot and an indoor crazy golf with 18 holes.
==Eastside City== Eastside City is the name of the redevelopment project that is set to transform an extensive former industrial [[brownfield]] area to the east of Nottingham city centre's historic core. This area stretches from the [[Nottingham Canal|Nottingham-Beeston Canal]] in the south towards the [[National Ice Centre]].<ref>[http://www.eastside-city.com/vision.asp?pnav=2&slide=2 Eastside & City Developments Background]</ref> At the heart of the [[Urban renewal|regeneration]] zone will be The Island site which will be totally overhauled to become a thriving city quarter with public open spaces, restaurants and bars and a new park for the city's inhabitants. The development will consist of new homes, offices and retail units.<ref>[http://www.eastside-city.com/vision.asp?pnav=2&slide=5 Eastside & City Developments Background]</ref>
==Notable buildings==
* Arkwright Building, [[Nottingham Trent University]] * Newton Building, [[Nottingham Trent University]] * [[Nottingham Council House]] * [[Nottingham Playhouse]] * [[Nottingham Castle]] * [[Nottingham Cathedral]] * [[St. Mary's Church, Nottingham|St. Mary's Church]] * [[Nottingham railway station]] * [[Broadmarsh Shopping Centre]] * [[Victoria Centre|Victoria Shopping Centre]] * Victoria Shopping Centre apartments * [[The Corner House, Nottingham|The Corner House]] * [[National Ice Centre]] * [[Theatre Royal, Nottingham|Theatre Royal]] * Marco Island * [[iQ Nottingham]] * Games Workshop's Warhammer World<ref>{{cite news|last1=Apartments|first1=City Space|title=Corporate Accommodation Nottingham|url=http://www.cs-apartments.co.uk/}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[https://www.google.com/search?sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=nottingham+city+centre Nottingham City Council] * [http://www.nottingham21.co.uk Images of Nottingham]
{{Nottingham}}
{{Nottinghamshire}}

{{Redirect|Obsolete|the album by Fear Factory|Obsolete (album)}} {{Refimprove|date=July 2007}}
[[File:London (1932) Ending the depression through planned obsolescence.pdf|thumb|''Ending the [[Depression (economics)|Depression]] Through Planned Obsolescence'' by Bernard London, 1932]]
'''Obsolescence''' is the state of being which occurs when an object, service, or practice is no longer wanted even though it may still be in good working order; however, the international standard EN62402 Obsolescence Management - Application Guide defines '''Obsolescence''' as being the "transition from availability of products by the original manufacturer or supplier to unavailability". Obsolescence frequently occurs because a replacement has become available that has, in sum, more advantages compared to the disadvantages incurred by maintaining or repairing the original. '''Obsolete''' also refers to something that is already disused or discarded, or antiquated.<ref>Fowler HW and Fowler FG (1st ed.), Thompson Delia (ed.) (1995). The Hardy Boyz use the term "obsolete mule" at times. ''The Concise Oxford Dictionary of Current English'', 9th Ed., Clarendon Press, Oxford. {{ISBN|0-19-861319-9}}.</ref> Typically, obsolescence is preceded by a gradual decline in popularity.
==Consequences== Driven by rapid [[technological change]]s, new components are developed and launched on the market with increasing speed. The result is a dramatic change in production methods of all components and their market availability. A growing industry sector is facing issues where life cycles of products no longer fit together with life cycles of required components. This issue is known as obsolescence, the status given to a part when it is no longer available from its original manufacturer. The problem of obsolescence is most prevalent for electronics technology, wherein the procurement lifetimes for microelectronic parts are often significantly shorter than the manufacturing and support life cycles for the products that use the parts. However, obsolescence extends beyond electronic components to other items, such as materials, textiles, and mechanical parts. In addition, obsolescence has been shown to appear for software, specifications, standards, processes, and soft resources, such as human skills. It is highly important to implement and operate an active management of obsolescence to mitigate and avoid extreme costs.<ref>Bjoern Bartels, Ulrich Ermel, Peter Sandborn and Michael G. Pecht (2012). ''Strategies to the Prediction, Mitigation and Management of Product Obsolescence'', 1st. Ed., John Wiley & Sons, Inc., Hoboken, New Jersey. {{ISBN|1-11-814064-8}} .</ref>
==Types==
===Technical obsolescence=== Technical obsolescence usually occurs when a new product or technology supersedes the old one, and it is preferred to use the new technology instead. Historical examples of new technologies superseding old ones include [[bronze]] replacing [[flint]] in hand-tools, [[DVD]]s replacing [[videocassette recorder|videocassettes]], and the [[telephone]] replacing the [[telegraph]]. On a smaller scale, a particular product may become obsolete when a newer version replaces it. Many products in the computer industry become obsolete in this manner. For example, [[central processing unit]]s (CPUs) frequently become obsolete in favor of newer, faster units. Singularly, rapid obsolescence of [[data]] formats along with their supporting hardware and software can lead to loss of critical information, a process known as [[digital obsolescence]].
In many cases, a new technology does not totally replace the old technology because the old technology is still useful in certain applications. For example, [[transistor]]s replaced [[vacuum tube]]s in TV and radio receivers in the 1960s, but vacuum tubes were still used for powerful transmitters because transistors for these power levels were not available. Even today, one has to use multiple transistors for a purpose that used to require just one tube.
Products may also become obsolete when supporting technologies are no longer available to produce or even repair a product. For example, many [[integrated circuit]]s, including CPUs, memory and even some relatively simple logic chips may no longer be produced because the technology has been superseded, their original developer has gone out of business or a competitor has bought them out and effectively killed off their products to remove competition. It is rarely worth redeveloping a product to get around these issues since its overall functionality and price/performance ratio has usually been superseded by that time as well.
Some products become technologically obsolete due to changes in complementary products which results in the function of the first product being made unnecessary. For example, [[buggy whip]]s became obsolete when people started to travel in cars rather than in horse-drawn buggies.
=== Functional obsolescence === Items become functionally obsolete when they can no longer adequately perform the function for which they were created. For example, while one could theoretically adapt an [[Avro Lancaster]] to deploy modern [[JDAM]] bombs, the situations in which it could actually succeed at doing so against modern air defenses would be so few that it would be essentially useless.
Manufacturers and repair companies will typically cease support for products once they become obsolete as keeping production lines in place and parts in storage for a shrinking user base becomes unprofitable. This causes scarcity of spare parts and skilled technicians for repairs and thus escalates maintenance costs for obsolete products. This ultimately leads to prohibitive expense in keeping old technology functioning.
=== Architectural obsolescence === The term "obsolescence" was first applied to the built environment in 1910 in an attempt to explain American skyscrapers' sudden loss of value.<ref name=":0">{{Cite journal|last=Abramson|first=Daniel|year=2012|title=From Obsolescence to Sustainability, Back Again, and Beyond|url=|journal=Design and Culture|volume=4|issue=3|pages=279-298|via=}}</ref> New York engineer Reginald P. Bolton attributed this phenomenon to "something new and better out-competing the old" and calculated the average architectural lifespan of varying building types in order to formulate a rough estimate for their impending obsolescence.<ref name=":0" /> For example, he suggested that hotel's obsolescence will occur faster than banks due to their ever-changing functions and tastes.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Building for Profit: Principles Governing the Economic Improvement of Real Estate|last=Bolton|first=R.P.|publisher=De Vinne|year=1911|isbn=|location=New York|pages=|quote=|via=}}</ref>
===Planned obsolescence=== {{Main article|Planned obsolescence}} Sometimes [[marketing|marketer]]s deliberately introduce obsolescence into their [[product management|product strategy]], with the objective of generating long-term sales volume by reducing the time between repeat purchases. One example might be producing an appliance which is deliberately designed to wear out within five years of its purchase, pushing consumers to replace it within five years.
===Style obsolescence=== [[File:Jimi Hendrix's bell-bottoms, Hard Rock Cafe Hollywood.JPG|thumb|right|180px|[[Jimi Hendrix]]'s bell-bottoms]]
When a product is no longer desirable because it has gone out of the popular fashion, its style is obsolete. One example is [[Bell-bottoms|flared leg jeans]]; although this article of clothing may still be perfectly functional, it is no longer desirable because style trends have moved away from the flared leg cut.
Because of the "fashion cycle", stylistically obsolete products may eventually regain popularity and cease to be obsolete. A current example is "[[Stone washing|acid-wash]]" jeans, which were popular in the 1980s, became stylistically obsolete in the mid to late 1990s, and returned to popularity in the 2000s.
===Obsolescence management=== {{Main article|DMSMS}}
Obsolescence management, also referred to as "Diminishing Manufacturing Sources and Material Shortages" (DMSMS), is defined as to the activities that are undertaken to mitigate the effects of obsolescence. Activities can include last-time buys, lifetime buys, and obsolescence monitoring.
==See also== {{Wiktionary|obsolescence|obsolete}} {{Columns-list|colwidth=30em| *[[Commodification]] *[[Deprecation]] *[[Disruptive innovation]] *[[DMSMS]] *[[List of obsolete technology]] *[[Moore's law]] *[[Planned obsolescence]] *[[Sustainable design]] }}
==References== {{Reflist}}
==Further reading== * Bjoern Bartels, Ulrich Ermel, Peter Sandborn, and Michael G. Pecht: ''Strategies to the Prediction, Mitigation and Management of Product Obsolescence'', 1st. Ed., John Wiley & Sons, Inc., Hoboken, New Jersey, 2012, {{ISBN|1-11-814064-8}}, ({{Google books|rgaUwTQIV6gC|online copy (Google)|page=}})
==External links== {{Wikiquote}} *{{Commonscat-inline}}

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2018}} [[File:Railway Interiors Expo logo.gif|thumb|Railway Interiors Expo]] '''Railway Interiors Expo''' is an annual [[industry]] show held in November, in varying locations. Organised by UKIP Media & Events the show has become a major event for the [[railway]] business since it was launched in 2004 and now visitors from over 60 countries attend.
Exhibitors at the Railway Interiors Expo offer a range of products and services related to [[train]] interiors, everything from seating and lighting to [[floor]] finishes and [[textile]]s, food service equipment, [[Wi-Fi]], in-train entertainment systems, to highlight only a few.<ref name="Replin to launch new collection at Railway Interiors Expo">{{cite web |url=http://www.aura-pr.com/index.php/weblog/comments/replin_to_launch_new_collection_at_railway_interiors_expo |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-08-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120330194344/http://www.aura-pr.com/index.php/weblog/comments/replin_to_launch_new_collection_at_railway_interiors_expo |archivedate=2012-03-30 |df= }}</ref>
Railway Interiors Expo is typically visited by genuine industry individuals, creating a beneficial opportunity for exhibitors to find new business opportunities, globally and at the same time providing all participants with a networking opportunity.
==2011== In 2011, Railway Interiors Expo will take place in hall 9 of the [[Koelnmesse]]<ref name="Koelnmesse shows">{{cite web |url=http://www.koelnmesse.com/en/messenundveranstaltungen/messeninkoeln/messeninkln.php?maxPerPage=100&sortBy=datum&sortType=ASC&filter%255Bbranche%255D=2&page=1 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-08-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110928075137/http://www.koelnmesse.com/en/messenundveranstaltungen/messeninkoeln/messeninkln.php?maxPerPage=100&sortBy=datum&sortType=ASC&filter%5Bbranche%5D=2&page=1 |archivedate=2011-09-28 |df= }}</ref> [[trade fair]] and exhibition center located in [[Cologne]], [[Germany]]. The expo will run from 15 to 17 November and will include over 100 exhibitors.<ref name="Railway Interiors 2011 exhibitor list">http://www.railwayinteriors-expo.com/exhib_list.php</ref>
In 2011 Railway Interiors Expo will feature a free to attend Design & Technology forum<ref name="free to attend Design & Technology forum">http://www.railpro.co.uk/events/</ref> and an Awards for Innovation & Excellence ceremony.
== References == <!--- See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Footnotes on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.railwayinteriors-expo.com/ railway interiors expo website]

revision.text:
'''Shareholder oppression''' occurs when the majority shareholders in a [[corporation]] take action that unfairly prejudices the minority. It most commonly occurs in [[close corporation]]s, because the lack of a public market for shares leaves minority shareholders particularly vulnerable, since minority shareholders cannot escape mistreatment by selling their stock and exiting the corporation.<ref>{{citation|author=Means, Benjamin|title=A Voice-Based Framework for Evaluating Claims of Minority Shareholder Oppression in the Close Corporation|date=October 15, 2008|publisher=Georgetown Law Journal|volume=97|ssrn=1285204}}</ref> The majority shareholders may harm the economic interests of the minority by refusing to declare [[dividend]]s or attempting a [[squeezeout]]. The majority may physically lock the minority out of the corporate premises and even deny the minority the right to inspect corporate records and books, making it necessary for the minority to sue every time it wants to look at them.<ref>{{citation|url=http://heinonlinebackup.com/hol-cgi-bin/get_pdf.cgi?handle=hein.journals/wasbur40&section=23|volume=40|publisher=Washburn L.J.|pages=288|date=2000–2001|title=Investor Beware: Protection of Minority Stakeholder Interests in Closely Held Limited-Liability Business Organizations: Delaware Law and Its Adherents|author=Meinhardt, J. Mark}}</ref> An important concept in law pertaining to shareholder oppression is the "[[reasonable expectations]]" of the minority shareholder.<ref>{{citation|volume=91|publisher=Minn. L. Rev.|pages=657|date=2006–2007|title=Simple Statutory Solution to Minority Oppression in the Closely Held Business, A|author1=Matheson, John H. |author2=Maler, R. Kevin |url=http://heinonlinebackup.com/hol-cgi-bin/get_pdf.cgi?handle=hein.journals/mnlr91&section=24}}</ref> The "[[fair dealing]]" standard is also sometimes used by courts.<ref>{{citation|title=Oppressed Shareholders in Close Corporations: A Market-Oriented Statutory Remedy|author=A Chernichaw|publisher=Cardozo L. Rev.|year=1994|url=https://litigation-essentials.lexisnexis.com/webcd/app?action=DocumentDisplay&crawlid=1&crawlid=1&doctype=cite&docid=16+Cardozo+L.+Rev.+501&srctype=smi&srcid=3B15&key=116829fdc5d5fc91ce646dd032dc16c4}}</ref>
The potential for shareholder oppression arguably increased when [[corporate law]] was changed to eliminate the [[common law]] right of minority shareholders to veto fundamental corporate changes such as [[merger]]s.<ref>{{citation|volume=1989|publisher=Duke L.J.|pages=258|year=1989|title=Rejecting the Minority Discount|author=Heglar, Robert B.|url=http://heinonlinebackup.com/hol-cgi-bin/get_pdf.cgi?handle=hein.journals/duklr1989&section=16}}</ref> It has been said that the [[business judgment rule]] and notions of [[majority rule]] have allowed shareholder majorities to use the minority's investment without paying for it.<ref>{{citation|volume=60|publisher=Miss. L.J.|pages=405|year=1990|title=Modern Remedies for Oppression in the Closely Held Corporation|author=Spratlin, Arthur D. Jr.|url=http://heinonlinebackup.com/hol-cgi-bin/get_pdf.cgi?handle=hein.journals/mislj60&section=19}}</ref> It has also been said, however, that it is difficult to determine how to deal with the rights of the minority shareholder without destroying the corporation, while still respecting the rights of the majority shareholder.<ref>{{citation|volume=14|publisher=DePaul Bus. L.J.|pages=381|date=2001–2002|title=Reasonable Expectations of Minority Shareholders in Closely Held Corporations: The Morality of Small Businesses, The|author=Grandfield, Cynthia S.|url=http://heinonlinebackup.com/hol-cgi-bin/get_pdf.cgi?handle=hein.journals/depbus14&section=29}}</ref>
The courts sometimes make [[oppression remedies]] available. An oppressed minority shareholder can ask the court to dissolve the corporation or to hold the corporation's leaders accountable for their [[fiduciary]] responsibilities.<ref>{{citation|url=http://heinonlinebackup.com/hol-cgi-bin/get_pdf.cgi?handle=hein.journals/busl48&section=39|volume=48|publisher=Bus. Law.|pages=699|date=1992–1993|title=Shareholder's Cause of Action for Oppression, The|author=Thompson, Robert B.}}</ref> Another remedy sometimes used is court-ordered purchase of shares.<ref>{{citation|url=http://heinonlinebackup.com/hol-cgi-bin/get_pdf.cgi?handle=hein.journals/jcorl28&section=22|volume=28|publisher=J. Corp. L.|pages=371|date=2002–2003|title=Shareholder Rights and Remedies in Close Corporations: Oppression, Fiduciary Duties, and Reasonable Expectations|author=Art, Robert C.}}</ref> As of 1997, the [[European Union]] still had not harmonized laws for dealing with shareholder oppression.<ref>{{citation|volume=30|publisher=Cornell Int'l L.J.|pages=381|year=1997|title=Minority Shareholder Oppression in the Private Company in the European Community: A Comparative Analysis of the German, United Kingdom, and French Close Corporation Problem|author=Miller, Sandra K.|url=http://heinonlinebackup.com/hol-cgi-bin/get_pdf.cgi?handle=hein.journals/cintl30&section=16}}</ref> In the [[United Kingdom]], the [[Companies Act 2006]] governs remedies for minority shareholder oppression.<ref>{{citation|title=The Theory of the Firm: Minority Shareholder Oppression: Sections 459-461 of the Companies Act 1985|author=DD Prentice|publisher=Oxford Journal of Legal Studies|year=1988|url=http://ojls.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/reprint/8/1/55.pdf}}</ref> Contractual protections, such as buyout provisions in a shareholder agreement, have been cited as a potential alternative to statutory protections of minority shareholders.<ref>{{citation|volume=24|publisher=Stetson L. Rev.|pages=267|date=1994–1995|title=Shareholders' Agreement: A Contractual Alternative to Oppression as a Ground for Dissolution, The|author=Brownlee, Hunter J.|url=http://heinonlinebackup.com/hol-cgi-bin/get_pdf.cgi?handle=hein.journals/stet24&section=14}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Corporate governance]] [[Category:Shareholders|Oppression]]

{{About|the television program|the [[Transformers (toyline)|Transformers]] character|Squawkbox (Transformers)|the communication device|Squawk box|the British political blog|The Skwawkbox}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2014}} {{Infobox television | show_name = Squawk Box | image = CNBC Squawk Box Ident 2014.png | image_size = 250px | caption = Logo from October 13, 2014 to December 31, 2015 | genre = [[business]] [[news program]], [[talk show]] | creator = | developer = | presenter = [[Joe Kernen]] (1995–present)
[[Rebecca Quick|Becky Quick]] (2005–present)
[[Andrew Ross Sorkin]] (2011–present)
[[Mark Haines]] (1995–2005)
[[Carl Quintanilla]] (2005–2011) | voices = | narrated = | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = | endtheme = | country = United States | language = English | num_seasons = | num_episodes = | list_episodes = | producer = | executive_producer = | location = [[Fort Lee, NJ]] (August 7, 1995 – October 10, 2003)
[[Englewood Cliffs, NJ]] (October 13, 2003 – January 6, 2015)
[[Time-Life Building]], [[New York City]] (January 7, 2015 – December 30, 2016)
[[NASDAQ MarketSite]], New York City (January 3, 2017 - present) | camera = | runtime = 180 minutes (3 hours) | network = [[CNBC]] | picture_format = 4:3 (August 7, 1995 – October 10, 2014)
16:9 (October 13, 2014 – present) | audio_format = | first_run = | first_aired = August 7, 1995 | last_aired = present | preceded_by = | followed_by = incumbent | related = | website = https://www.cnbc.com/squawk-box-us/ }} [[Image:Becky Quick 2-1.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Becky Quick "on location" for ''Squawk Box'']] [[Image:111807h.jpg|250px|thumb|The ''Squawk Box'' set from October 2003 to March 2011]] [[Image:Squawkbox oldgraphics.jpg|200px|thumb|right|''Squawk Box'' at launch – 1995]] '''''Squawk Box''''' is a business news [[television program]] that airs at breakfast time on the [[CNBC]] network. The program is currently co-hosted by [[Joe Kernen]], [[Rebecca Quick|Becky Quick]], and [[Andrew Ross Sorkin]]. Since debuting in 1995, the show has spawned a number of versions across CNBC's international channels, many of which employ a similar format. The program title originates from a term used in [[Investment banking|investment banks]] and stock [[broker]]ages for a [[Squawk box|permanent voice circuit]] or [[intercom]] used to communicate stock deals or sales priorities; it also may refer to the squawk of a bird, like a [[peacock]], which is the logo of CNBC. ==Format== Dubbed "our [[pre-game show]]" by regular co-host [[Joe Kernen]],{{Cite news |last=Strauss |first=Robert |title=NEW JERSEY & CO.; All Eyes Are on Fort Lee |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=980CE1DE1E31F930A15757C0A9669C8B63 |date=April 23, 2000 |publisher=''[[The New York Times]]'' |accessdate=November 26, 2007}} ''Squawk Box'' features early-morning analysis of and [[breaking news]] from the [[financial market]]s, along with considerable banter between the hosts and their guests – original host [[Mark Haines]] stressed the need to "inject a little fun" into business news in the early morning. Another distinctive and long-running feature of the show has been its use of daily "guest hosts" – figures from the world of business and [[politics]] who join the team for much of the broadcast, questioning guests as well as offering their own opinions. Regular contributors to the show include [[Sharon Epperson]] ([[NYMEX]]), [[Rick Santelli]] (Chicago), [[Steve Liesman]], [[Guy Adami]] and CNBC senior analyst [[Ron Insana]]. Meteorologists from [[The Weather Channel]] contribute to the "Business Travel Forecast" segments. ==History== ''Squawk Box''’s core on-air team remained intact for many years – the program was originally presented by [[New Jersey]] lawyer Mark Haines, along with in-studio reporters Joe Kernen, [[David Faber (CNBC)|David Faber]] and [[Maria Bartiromo]] at the [[New York Stock Exchange]]. CNBC's senior economics reporter Steve Liesman also became a frequent contributor. [[Alexis Glick]] joined the team as senior trading correspondent in May 2003,{{Cite web |last=Thomas-Graham |first=Pamela |title=CELEBRATION 50: WHAT I LEARNED AT HARVARD LAW SCHOOL |url=http://www.law.harvard.edu/students/orgs/jlg/vol27/thomas-graham.php#fn1 |date=May 3, 2003 |publisher=[[Harvard Law School]] |accessdate=November 26, 2007}} while Bartiromo stepped down from her position in 2004 to concentrate on other duties.{{Cite news |last=Patsuris |first=Penelope |title=Mornings Without Maria? |url=https://www.forbes.com/2004/05/13/cx_pp_0513maria.html |date=May 13, 2004 |publisher=''[[Forbes]]'' |accessdate=November 26, 2007}} [[Rebecca Quick]] later replaced Glick as a reporter. For many years the program covered the opening bells of the New York Stock Exchange and [[NASDAQ|NASDAQ Stock Market]] at 9:30 a.m. Eastern Time. Other regular segments included the ''Squawk Exchange'', where the team (particularly Faber and Kernen) shared banter on various topics, ''On the Box'' (rapid-fire summaries of the day's headlines) and ''Joe's World'', where Kernen sounded off on the day's notable [[stock]] stories. During the period when CNBC's online presence was housed at [[MSN|MSN Money]], the show held its own daily ''Squawk Back Poll'' on the website, where viewers voted on a topical issue. In May 2005 the program established its own [[blog]] on [[Windows Live Spaces]], called ''SquawkBlog'', where the program hosts posted their thoughts, although this is no longer in use. ===2005 revamp=== The program underwent a significant revamp on December 19, 2005, with the show moving to the 6:00 am ET timeslot and Kernen, Quick and [[Carl Quintanilla]] helming a new tri-anchor format alongside on-air editor [[Charles Gasparino]]. Haines and Faber moved to a newly created program, ''[[Squawk on the Street]]'', anchored from the NYSE by Haines and [[Erin Burnett]] with Faber at CNBC headquarters. As a result of these changes, coverage of the market open at 9:30am ET passed to ''Squawk on the Street''. The "guest host" feature of ''Squawk Box'' was dropped immediately after the revamp but later reinstated. There was a significant amount of initial negative feedback about the changes made to ''Squawk'', most notably the removal of Mark Haines from the team.{{Cite web |title=CNBC Has Received "Tens of Thousands" of Complaints About New Graphics & Noises |url=http://www.mediabistro.com/tvnewser/cnbc/cnbc_has_received_tens_of_thousands_of_complaints_about_new_graphics_noises_29989.asp |date=December 27, 2005 |publisher=[[TV Newser]] |accessdate=November 26, 2007}} On the ''Squawk Box'' blog, over 200 complaints were entered into the site, along with numerous messages posted on the CNBC message board.{{Cite web |last=Quintanilla |first=Carl |authorlink=Carl Quintanilla |title=Why The New Squawk Box? |url=http://squawkblog.spaces.live.com/blog/cns!F1B804819090AC65!2185.entry |date=December 16, 2005 |publisher=[[CNBC]] |accessdate=November 26, 2007}} ===2011–present=== On July 8, 2011, Quintanilla left ''Squawk Box'' to become part of the new ''Squawk on the Street'' anchor team, following Haines' death on May 24 of that year. His new assignment began three days later, when he debuted with [[Melissa Lee (journalist)|Melissa Lee]] and Simon Hobbs. [[Andrew Ross Sorkin]] of ''[[The New York Times]]'', joined Kernen and Quick in order to succeed Quintanilla's anchoring duties. Sorkin made his debut as co-anchor July 18, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2011/07/nyts-andrew-ross-sorkin-joins-cnbcs-squawk-box-147415/|title=NYT's Sorkin Joins CNBC's 'Squawk Box'|work=Deadline|author=Lieberman, David|date=July 15, 2011|accessdate=December 27, 2014}} On October 13, 2014, ''Squawk Box'', along with CNBC's other trading-day shows, were launched in full 1080i high-definition as part of a network-wide switch to a full 16:9 letterbox presentation on that same day. On January 7, 2015, ''Squawk Box'' moved to a new street-side studio inside the [[Time-Life Building]] in [[New York City]] after almost two decades in New Jersey (at CNBC's original facilities in Fort Lee from its August 7, 1995, debut to October 10, 2003, and at CNBC's facilities in Englewood Cliffs from October 13, 2003, to January 6, 2015). On January 4, 2016, ''Squawk Box'' debuted a remastered version of its logo used since October 13, 2014. On February 8, 2016, both the Asian and European versions also started using the remastered ''Squawk Box'' logo. On November 14, 2016, it was officially announced by the [[NASDAQ]] that production of ''Squawk Box'' would be relocated to the [[NASDAQ MarketSite]] studio in Times Square; it began broadcasting from there on January 3, 2017. That same studio is also shared with CNBC's two other shows, ''[[Fast Money (CNBC)|Fast Money]]'' and ''Options Action'' (the latter airing on Fridays only; both shows are hosted by [[Melissa Lee]]). On November 15, 2017, ''Squawk Box'' moved downstairs to a new street-level studio overlooking Times Square, also at the NASDAQ MarketSite. ==Show times== The program airs from 6 a.m. until 9 a.m. [[North American Eastern Time Zone|Eastern Time]] in the United States. It is relayed in its entirety live on [[CNBC Europe]] although it is sometimes partially pre-empted for local programming, particularly to cover [[European Central Bank]] interest rate announcements and the subsequent [[news conference|press conferences]]. In Asia, the show is aired in its entirety on [[CNBC Asia]] from Mondays to Fridays (vary between time to time during U.S. Daylight Saving Time and Standard Time). Also, it can be air in New Zealand from Tuesdays to Saturdays during [[Time in New Zealand|Daylight Saving Time]] when U.S. is on Eastern Standard Time. ==Spin-offs== ===''Squawk Box Weekend Edition''=== CNBC once aired '''''Squawk Box Weekend Edition''''' weekends from 7:30 to 8 pm ET during c. 1999 to 2000, also hosted by Mark Haines. ===Worldwide ''Squawk Box''=== Around CNBC's global branches, there are many "Squawk Boxes" in the world: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Channel || Program || Still Run? || Presenters |- | rowspan=2 | [[CNBC Europe]] || '''''[[Squawk Box Europe]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear app clean.svg|20px]] (1996—present) || [[Geoff Cutmore]], [[Steve Sedgwick]] and [[Karen Tso]] |- | '''''[[Squawk Outside The Box]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear action button cancel.svg|20px]] (2007) || [[Geoff Cutmore]] |- | rowspan=2 | [[CNBC Asia]] || '''''[[Asia Squawk Box]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear app clean.svg|20px]] (February 2, 1998—present) || Akiko Fujita, [[Bernard Lo]] |- | '''''[[Squawk Australia]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear action button cancel.svg|20px]] (March 26, 2007 – June 11, 2010) || [[Oriel Morrison]] |- | [[Nikkei CNBC]] || '''''[[Tokyo Squawk Box]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear action button cancel.svg|20px]] || |- | [[CNBC-TV18]] || '''''[[Bazaar (CNBC-TV18)|Bazaar]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear action button cancel.svg|20px]] (1999—2004) || |- | [[CNBC-e]] || '''''[[Geri Sayım]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear app clean.svg|20px]] (October 16, 2000—present) || |- | [[Class CNBC]] || '''''[[Caffè Affari]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear app clean.svg|20px]] (?—present) || |- | [[CNBC Arabiya]] || '''''[[Aswak Al Mal]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear app clean.svg|20px]] (?—present) || |- | [[CNBC Africa]] || '''''[[Squawk Box Africa]]''''' || [[Image:Crystal Clear app clean.svg|20px]] (2008-04-07(?)—present) || |} Among the above, '''''Squawk Box Europe''''' and '''''Asia Squawk Box''''' are the counterparts which resemble the original '''''Squawk Box''''' the most: *They are all three hours in duration. *They all have a guest host appearing on the show, mostly after the first hour. *In addition, Maria Bartiromo has served as a guest co-anchor on both ''Squawk Box Europe'' and ''Asia Squawk Box''. (Karen Tso moved to the Asian version of ''Squawk Box'' (and was based in Singapore) and after [[Amanda Drury]] briefly replaced Tso on ''Squawk Australia'', Oriel Morrison moved into that role in 2010 while Drury is now based in CNBC World Headquarters in the U.S.). Tso moved to the European version of ''Squawk Box'' after joining CNBC Europe in 2011. ==''Fantasy Portfolio Challenge''== 150,221 players participated in the ''Squawk Box Fantasy Portfolio Challenge'', a stock-picking contest that ran from April 4, 2006 through May 26, 2006. The winner of the ''Squawk Box Fantasy Portfolio Challenge'', which was announced live at the end of the 2 June 2006 episode, was Thomas Ko of [[California]]. His $5,015,735 [[Portfolio (finance)|portfolio]] value outpaced all the other contenders. He was also the winner of a brand-new, limited-production, 2006 [[Maserati GranSport]]. ==See also== *''[[Squawk Box Europe]]'' *''[[Asia Squawk Box]]'' *''[[Squawk on the Street]]'' *''[[Squawk Alley]]'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[https://www.cnbc.com/squawk-box-us/ ''Squawk Box'' – CNBC.com] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20050525014837/http://spaces.msn.com/members/squawkblog/ SquawkBlog] (formerly the show's official [[blog]]) on [[MSN Spaces]] *[https://www.cnbc.com/id/15837814 New "Squawk Blog": ''Before the Bell'' on CNBC.com (Since 2006-12-04)] *{{imdb title|0972177}} {{CNBC Business Day}} {{CNBC Europe Business Day}} {{CNBC Asia Business Day}} {{US morning news shows}} [[Category:CNBC programs]] [[Category:CNBC Europe programmes]] [[Category:CNBC Asia programs]] [[Category:American television news programs]] [[Category:American television talk shows]] [[Category:1990s American television series]] [[Category:1995 American television series debuts]] [[Category:2000s American television series]] [[Category:Blogs]] [[Category:Business-related television series]] [[Category:2010s American television series]] [[Category:English-language television programs]]
