revision.text:
{{BLP sources|date=April 2010}} {{Infobox person | name = Sven Hagströmer | image =sven_fg_highres_1.jpg | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1943|11|30|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Stockholm]], [[Sweden]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = [[Businessman]], [[Entrepreneur]] | salary = | children = | website = | imagesize = | spouse = }}
'''Sven Johan Gösta Barthen Hagströmer''' (born 30 November 1943) is a [[Sweden|Swedish]] business executive, best known as the founder of [[Avanza Bank]]<ref>[https://www.avanza.se/aza/omavanza/pdf/cv/sven_hagstromer.pdf Avanza, about Sven Hagströmer]</ref> and investment company Creades.<ref>[http://www.creades.se/om-creades/ Creades, about Sven Hagströmer]</ref> He is also the initiator of the non-profit organizations AllBright<ref>[http://www.allbright.se/new-page-2/ AllBright, about Sven Hagströmer] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317045831/http://www.allbright.se/new-page-2/ |date=2016-03-17 }}</ref> and Berättarministeriet.<ref>[http://berattarministeriet.se/om-oss/styrelse Berättarministeriet, about Sven Hagströmer]</ref>
==Education and early career== Sven Hagströmer studied economics at [[Stockholm University]]. He was a portfolio manager at Gränges AB from 1969 to 1973 and at Investor from 1973 to 1980. He started the firm Sven Hagströmer Fondkommission AB in 1981. It later turned into the commercial bank Hagströmer & Qviberg, publicly known as [[HQ Bank]]. HQ Bank was the principal owner of Investment AB Öresund, which was divided into two companies in 2012. Business partners Sven Hagströmer and Mats Qviberg went separate ways and Sven Hagströmer became the principal owner of the newly formed investment company Creades. Amongst a number of directorships, he is now Chairman of the Board of both Avanza Bank and Creades. Sven Hagströmer is a dedicated entrepreneur and was one of the venture capitalist "dragons" in the Swedish version of the television program [[Dragons' Den (Canadian TV series)|Dragons’ Den]] on [[Sveriges Television|SVT]].<ref>[http://www.driva-eget.se/nyheter/pengar/han-satsade-mest-i-draknastet "Satsade mest i Draknästet"] Driva-eget.se</ref>
==Political views== Sven Hagströmer is involved in various social projects, including Arbetsmäklarna at Tensta School where he helps young students get in touch with employers. He believes that Swedish companies are not doing enough to bring in people from other cultures.<ref>[http://www.va.se/nyheter/vagrar-sitta-med-armarna-i-kors-77127/ "Vägrar sitta med armarna i kors"] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20120711182414/http://www.va.se/nyheter/vagrar-sitta-med-armarna-i-kors-77127 |date=2012-07-11 }} Veckans Affärer</ref> Hagströmer is opposed to the euro and was one of the initiators to the political party Junilistan.<ref>[http://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/pressreleases/foeraendring-i-junilistans-styrelse-109615 "Förändring i Junilistans styrelse"] Junilistan</ref><ref>[http://www.dn.se/nyheter/politik/junilistan-far-draghjalp-till-riksdagen-av-finansman/ "Junilistan får draghjälp till riksdagen av finansman" ] Dagens Nyheter</ref> He believes that the euro reduces the Riksbank's influence over monetary policy.<ref>[http://www.aftonbladet.se/nyheter/article10394197.ab "-Visst minskar EMU folkets inflytande"] Aftonbladet</ref> Sven Hagströmer is a relative of Raoul Wallenberg and he founded the Raoul Wallenberg Academy in 2012. He is a passionate book collector<ref>[http://www.fokus.se/2007/11/sven-hagstromer-finansman-och-slaktare/ "Sven Hagströmer - finansman och slaktare"] Fokus. Read 3 August 2010</ref><ref>[http://www.svt.se/2.108659/1.1495855/sven_hagstromer "Sven Hagströmer - styrelseordförande i Investment AB Öresund, Avanza och Ework samt styrelseledamot i Bilia"] SVT. Read 3 August 2010</ref> and founded the publishing agency Fri Tanke together with Christer Sturmark and Björn Ulvaeus in 2007. Sven Hagströmer is one of the initiators of Berättarministeriet, which runs writing workshops in areas with high unemployment rates. He is also committed to gender issues and is frequently seen in the public gender equality debate. In 2011 he founded the AllBright foundation that works in order to increase the number of women holding positions of power within the business sector.
==References==
===Footnotes=== <references/>
===Literature=== *[[Carolina Neurath]]: ''Den stora bankhärvan'', [[Norstedts]], 2011
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Hagstromer, Sven}} [[Category:1943 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Swedish businesspeople]] [[Category:Stockholm University alumni]] [[Category:Swedish billionaires]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Stockholm]]

{{Infobox person | name = Yuri Aizenshpis | image = File:Yuri Aizenshpis.jpg | birth_name = Yuri Shmilevich Ayzenshpis | birth_date = {{birth date|1945|07|15}} | birth_place = [[Chelyabinsk]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2005|09|20|1945|07|15}} | death_place = [[Moscow]] | resting_place= | death_cause=[[myocardial infarction]] | occupation = producer | years_active = 1965–2005 | spouse = Yelena Kovrigina}} '''Yuri Shmilevich Ayzenshpis''' ({{lang-ru|Ю́рий Шми́льевич Айзеншпи́с}}; July 15, 1945 in [[Chelyabinsk]],<ref name="н">[http://m-necropol.narod.ru/aizenshpis.html Могилы знаменитостей. Айзеншпис Юрий Шмильевич (1945—2005)]</ref>[[Soviet Union]] – September 20, 2005 in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]]) was a Russian music manager and producer.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20110314121533/http://belopolye.narod.ru/known_people/july/aizenshpis.htm Юрий Шмильевич АЙЗЕНШПИС * Биография * Фотографии]</ref><ref>[http://www.peoples.ru/undertake/show_bisness/aizenshpis/ Юрий Шмелевич Айзеншпис / Yury Aizenshpis]</ref><ref>[http://www.music.global-project.ru/experts/aizenshpic.html Эксперты и деятели шоу-бизнеса: Юрий Айзеншпис]</ref>
He graduated from the [[Moscow State University of Economics, Statistics, and Informatics]] (1968).
January 7, 1970 Yuri Ayzenshpis was arrested. As a result of a search, 15,585 rubles was confiscated as well as his flat and 7,675 dollars. He was convicted on 88 charges (infringement of rules on currency transactions). He was released from prison in 1988 after serving 18 years in prison.<ref>[http://www.polit.ru/news/2005/09/21/death.html ПОЛИТ.РУ \ НОВОСТИ \ Смерть Юрия Айзеншписа: подробности, биография]</ref><ref>[http://icqvipgold.ucoz.ru/forum/14-65-1 Форум портала «Всё для ICQ»]</ref>
Since December 1989, before the death of [[Viktor Tsoi]] in 1990, he has been the director and producer of the group [[Kino (band)|Kino]].<ref name="regnum.ru">[http://www.regnum.ru/news/515822.html Скончался продюсер Юрий Айзеншпис: биография]</ref>
Beginning in 1991, he produced for the groups [[Technology (band)|Technology]], [[Moralny codex]], and Dynamite, and singers [[Linda (singer)|Linda]], [[Vlad Stashevsky]],<ref>[http://bukvoid.com.ua/digest/2012/04/07/215400.html Влад Листьев легко «кидал» людей] — Літературний дайджест / Буквоїд</ref><ref>[http://www.business-gazeta.ru/article/57436/ "Убивать Влада никто не хотел. Но он мешал Бадри Патаркацишвили проводить реформу на «первой кнопке»] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150721062623/http://www.business-gazeta.ru/article/57436/ |date=July 21, 2015 }}</ref> Nikita, and [[Sasha Gradiva]]. He was the winner of the Russian national music award [[Ovation (award)|Ovation]] for Best Producer in 1992 and 1995). He was also the first producer for [[Dima Bilan]].<ref>[http://www.bylan.ru/bio.php Дима Билан — Биография]</ref> From 2001 until his death he was the company Media Star's CEO.
Ayzenshpis died September 20, 2005 at about 20:00 from [[myocardial infarction]] in the City Clinical Hospital No. 20.<ref name="regnum.ru"/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.toppop.ru/news/ajzenshpis__chelovek_s_zheleznym_sterzhnem_/ Айзеншпис: человек с «железным стержнем», подробная биография] * [http://statehistory.ru/3104/Vospominaniya-YUriya-Ayzenshpisa-o-Viktore-TSoe/ Воспоминания Юрия Айзеншписа о Викторе Цое]
{{Authority control}}
